review.title: Perfect location close to AT&T Park!

Because we were only in town for 2 days we wanted to park the car and forget about driving. The location was perfect and we had a quick, professional check-in and valet service.  Friendly staff, giving us all the info we needed up front including in-house restaurant hours, wi-fi access codes, and layout of the lobby, elevators, etc. Plenty of restaurants, coffee shops, and breweries in the neighborhood within walking distance.  We would definitely book this Marriott again for the half marathon and consider it for future baseball games.

From cars speeding by to collage age kids coming home at 2 am from a night of partying, I don't feel this is a good hotel for families.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for the great review! We are happy to read we were able to meet your expectations you have with our brand, and that you were impressed with our on-site facilities, especially the fitness center and Starbucks. Our experienced catering service staff does a wonderful job in serving delicious food that our chef creates daily, so your kind remarks will be certainly shared with them. Thanks again, and we hope to have the opportunity to welcome you soon. 
Best regards,

Debbie Bonafede,
General Manager

review.title: Convenient for business travel and close to Moscon
review.reviewText: This is a standard Courtyard property and very consistent with the brand. The newly renovated gym is a big plus in a city where gyms are not standard in most hotels, as are the pool area. There is a lovely lounge area at the lobby level with a bar and restaurant with a small menu that is convenient for eat in or take away. There's a Starbucks in the lobby and a small number of conference rooms, which makes this property a great base for a business trip or conference/convention. The staff for our meeting was efficient and the food was appropriate for the meetings.
review.positiveRemarks: Newly renovated gym had good variety and quality of equipment. Pool area nice addition for swimmers and great to have a small restaurant and bar.
review.negativeRemarks: an in-room safe would be useful for business travelers and devices. A robe would be nice as well.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to Moscone, SOMA and related areas. Nearby hotels include W, Marriott Marquis, etc.

We will look into the issues you mentioned regarding parking charges not being listed and we will make the necessary changes as needed.  We hope you will give us a chance to prove this to you the next time that your plans bring you back to San Francisco.

Debbie Bonafede

review.title: Excellent Hotel for Business Stay
review.reviewText: My first time here and I was impressed with the location and the quality of this place.  It's about 3 blocks from the Bart/Muni Subway and the financial area of San Francisco.  It's also not so close to the major Market Street where you get all the traffic sound and craziness of the street.  Chinatown is also about 15 minutes leisurely walk.  Part of the hotel is facing the freeway.  Make sure to ask for a room on the other side of the building.  Also ask for a room AWAY from the elevator.  You definitely can hear the people chatting loudly in and out of the elevator.  WiFi is fast here.  Unfortunately, this hotel is located in the more pricer part of town, so you won't get much of mom-and-pop type of restaruants nearby.  Only 24hr. Subway a block way, but a lot of homeless people squat there late at night.  So do plan a little walk if you want a foodie experience toward the Union Square area and beyond.

We look forward to hosting you and your family soon.

review.title: Great for families
review.reviewText: We would stay here again. It's in a quiet location which was great after a full day of crowds. Our kids loved the indoor pool.  It's one of the nicest Courtyards we have stayed in. Best part: they allowed us to check in at 9 am because of our early arrival!

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText:
The location of the hotel is great, you don't have to worry about the downtown craziness. Though at the same time it's walking/uber distance to a lot of prime locations. 

The only fault I have is upon arrival, staff wasn't so informative about extra charges that would be charged to my card or information on the valet parking that was included with my booking through Expedia.

I was charged $20 twice and $50 dollars once on my card, I will be calling to see about these charges, as my one night stay with free valet parking was booked at $214 for the night. I'll give it a couple days to see if it will be refunded.

Overall my stay was great, the cleanliness of the hotel and comfortability was expected with Marriott, as I stayed with them before in other cities.

I would book again if needed.

review.title: Great Customer Service
review.reviewText:
The customer service at the hotel was excellent from Valet ( which is ridiculously expensive) to check in and restaurant  staff we were very pleased. The room was clean and spacious and we loved having a refrigerator  in the room. 
The only issue we had is that there was major construction on the road outside our room and it started at 6:30am on Saturday morning. Obviously the hotel didn't have control over this, but I would not stay there again until the construction is completed. It made it difficult to sleep and the noise continued throughout the day.

photos.caption: Granite top sink area with closet
good sized room, sofa, desk and tv

managementResponses.response:
Wow! Thank you so much for a glowing review of the Courtyard San Francisco Downtown. We couldn't be more pleased that your stay with us earned the highest rating. It’s always a treat to read positive comments such as yours because it is a great motivator for us to continually work to exceed your expectations. Thanks again for recommending us to other online travelers. It was our pleasure to have you as our guest and we can’t wait to host you again on a future visit to San Francisco.

Debbie Bonafede
General Manager

review.title: Fabulous 5 days Courtyard Downtown SF
review.reviewText: Everything about this hotel is as good as the reviews on tripadvisor and expedia! Great location and good neighbourhood - felt safe and close to everything - short walk to Union Square, good restaurants close by (especially Osha Thai on 3rd St (Yum)). Wonderful Starbucks downstairs in Marriott opens at 6 am! $12 average cab fair to Fishermans Wharf or city bus for $2.25. Extremely clean, great views from our 15th floor. Great Marriott bed. Well kept property and excellent staff. The premises, lobby, lounge and outside courtyard with fireplace are wonderful creating a great mood. Food was very good at Whispers Lounge/Bar. Can't say enough positives about this hotel. Perfect first time stay in SF! Highly recommend.
review.negativeRemarks: Can't think of anything negative to say. Nothing to improve.
review.locationRemarks: Very good and safe location. Near Union Square. Short bus drive or taxi to Fishermans Wharf. Easy to get to the Hop on Hop off buses and other tours.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for choosing our hotel for your stay. I am glad that our location with its proximity to AT & T Park was perfect for your needs. However, I am sorry for not meeting your expectations with regard to our breakfast offerings. We appreciate your candid feedback and hope to welcome you soon.

Debbie Bonafede
General Manager

review.title: Easy walk to the ball game
review.reviewText: We chose this hotel because it was near AT&T Park.  It was otherwise only fairly well located.  Since it is in the South Of Market Area there weren't many restaurants open on the weekends, and particularly a dearth of breakfast places.  Everything was pre-made grab and go pastries with overpriced coffee.
review.positiveRemarks:
Location near the Giants game
Friendly staff, even if they weren't really knowledgeable about the area or the resources.
review.negativeRemarks: A decent breakfast place nearby

managementResponses.response:
Thank you so much for the positive feedback about your stay, especially the kind comments about our staff. Making sure that each guest's stay is flawless is what we strive for every day. We were happy to read how much you loved our seamless check in service and your immaculate as well as well-equipped guest room. Thank you again for recommending us to other online travelers and we are glad that you are planning to return to our hotel.

Debbie Bonafede
General Manager

review.title: Nice Hotel in the Heart of SOMA.
review.reviewText: Hotel was recommended. We were able to book the room without difficulties. The staff was very professional and courteous at all times. Check in and check out was seamless. Our room was very clean and quiet. The bed, pillows and comforter were clean and very comfortable. We had plenty of nice, clean towels and toiletries for our needs. We will be staying there again next time we're in S.F.
review.positiveRemarks: We like the location, cleanliness of the room, very quiet and clean. Lobby and atrium were nice gathering places at the beginning and end of the day.
review.negativeRemarks: More outlets for electronics near the bed. A room safe was not available.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is located in San Francisco's SOMA district. Everything is within walking distance. If not, an Uber can easily take you there.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you so much for posting such a wonderful review, especially highlighting my staff. They will be thrilled to hear that their efforts are being recognized. Our entire team is invested in providing you with a memorable stay and your positive comments motivate us to keep up the hard work. We want the Courtyard Downtown to be your "home away from home" every time that you visit San Francisco. Thanks again for the kind words. We eagerly look forward to your next visit.

Best regards,

Debbie Bonafede
General Manager

review.title: great time had by all!!
review.reviewText: we had a wonderful stay.  The staff was beyond helpful and friendly.  No matter what the staff members official job was, it didn't matter...   they all helped each other in each aspect of the smooth running hotel and business.  I would  DEFINITELY  like to stay there again!
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, restaurants, etc.

managementResponses.response:
We appreciate your outstanding review of the Courtyard San Francisco Downtown. We agree with you that our hotel is ideally located to the best sights our downtown has to offer. I am also pleased to hear that you loved your room, bed and amenities. We look forward to having you stay with us again.

Best regards,

Debbie Bonafede
General Manager

review.title: Centrally located near tourists attractions
review.reviewText: Great hotel, however expect to pay a high (valet) parking fee per night as they do not have self parking on site.  Walking distance from public transportation, dinning, and museums. Comfy beds, good wall insulation/minimum sound, and nice amenities.  Perfect for our family trip.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for your candid review. I am sorry that you were disappointed with the cost of parking. As with most major downtown locations, there is an expense associated with convenient parking. We continually evaluate our costs and the surrounding market to keep our prices in check. We hope this did not overshadow your otherwise pleasant stay with us. We do hope to have you as our guest again in future.

Best regards,

Debbie Bonafede
General Manager

review.reviewText: Parking fee was high. Next time I would consider a hotel in Oakland and drive in to SF for family vacation.

review.title: Great hotel downtown
review.reviewText: For the type of hotel they need to at least serve a Continental breakfast.

review.title: Close to at & t ball park
review.reviewText: Went to a Giants ball game and stayed at one of the closest hotels to AT & T Park.
review.negativeRemarks: Shows its age. Worn carpets, dirty windows, etc.
review.locationRemarks: Close to down town and ball park.

review.title: Favorite hotel close to AT&T Park
review.reviewText: Great hotel and a quick walk to the Giants stadium. Hotel is VERY kid friendly as is the staff. They have wonderful customer service and are eager to help, whether it is with luggage, obtaining your car from valet, or arranging shuttle service to the airport. There is a bar/restaurant on the mainfloor as well as a Starbucks.

review.title: Giants & family
review.reviewText: We chose the hotel based on location and experience with the brand. Good location for walking to ball park and tourist things.  Service was excellent, staff were friendly and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: Location for our activities.  Hotel is clean and up to date.  Rooms were quiet.   Nice lobby with several seating areas  outdoor patio with fire pit
review.negativeRemarks: Good breakfast options but pricey.  Rates are less on weekends and increased $100 on weekdays, which is opposite of tourist areas.
review.locationRemarks: Financial district, 7 blks to AT&T park,  4-5 blks to transportation (bus,etc)  Hotel had list of restaurants that were close and good.

review.title: very bad desicion
review.reviewText: It is very difficult to trust again on Expedia and the hotel.It was the worst experience I've had in all my vacation, since I remember...

review.title: Good hotel, but, bad costumer service.
review.reviewText: How do you like getting yealed at when you call the front desk?! Then hang up the phone on you?! Absolutely not!!! Good hotel bad staff.
FANTASTIC hotel and location!!! Everything was perfect - from the front desk staff, to the room, to the delicious free breakfast! Will definitely stay here again (and again)!

review.title: Perfect hotel for sf giants games
review.reviewText: Great hotel to watch some baseball games. Walking distance, easy access to cabs or uber..perfect hotel for a busy city.
Staff were very gracious about altering the dates of a reservation that was booked in the wrong date range, at no charge, which is above and beyond what I expected.

review.title: Great price, great for walking lots of places
review.reviewText: Stayed here for a girls' weekend. Perfect for walking to the Ferry Building or Union Square. Was much nicer than we expected. Nice workout facility, great staff.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenience for walking around, at a great price.
review.locationRemarks: Great for walking lots of places, including the Ferry Building and Union Square.

review.title: Nice hotel with great service
review.reviewText:
Clean and comfortable room with all the amenities. We stayed 2 nights with our kids ages 4 and 1. The staff was wonderful. Always cheerful and helpful. The restaurant food was good. We used the indoor pool. Everything was very clean. Great location. We walked to local restaurants. On site Starbucks. 
Valet parking for a fee.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for your feedback and for choosing to stay with us. We hope to see you again in the near future.

All the best,

Vika Kafovalu
Guest Experience Coordinator

review.title: Nice hotel, 15min walk to the park
review.reviewText: Nice, clean, excellent customer service, 15min walk to the park with a Starbucks conveniently located in the lobby. Would recommend to anyone catching a Giants game.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for your feedback. I have shared your experience with our Valet and Front Desk team members. This has prompted us to be more aware and well versed in the matter. We hope to continue to be your hotel of choice when traveling to San Francisco.

Warm regards,

Vika Kafovalu
Guest Experience Coordinator

review.title: Parking
review.reviewText: I knew the Hotel only offed Valet parking but never thought it would be $57 a night.  I asked the attendant about the street parking with a Handicap card and he said that you still have to paid and start feeding the meter at 6am.  I live in LA and know all meter parking is free with a Handicap card so I said Ok ill feed the meter at 6am, then he say's well there's a lot of brake ins on the street so you know.  I went to check in and asked the lady about the parking and she said the same thing you have to pay so I said as of when and she said 2years ago.  I thought I would take my chances so I went to the room and started looking up parking in San Fran and found a number to call 311 for parking questions that is open 24hours.  The lady on the phone assured me that is was free to park at any city owned meter at all times. I parked in front of the Hotel for free all weekend no thanks to the staff I think they just want more money.

review.title: Good stay for only 2 nights
review.reviewText: It's a good Hotel, but not excellent. I hoped with that price I can have better rooms such Marriott Marquis the difference is only $40 but the quality is much higher.
review.negativeRemarks: Safety after midnight along the 2nd street. No free/cheap parking around the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: near the transportation, the pier, chinatown, downtown,... walking distance.

review.reviewText: The hotel staff were friendly, helpful and knowledgeable.

review.title: Great hotel with a great location
review.reviewText: I will definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who  wants to stay in central SF!

review.title: Everything was perfect!
review.reviewText: The staff was wonderful, the room was immaculate - everything exceeded our expectations.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, Chinatown was within walking distance (Chinese New Year).

review.title: Nice hotel in a good location
review.reviewText: I was pleased with my stay.  We had a regular room for my wife and two kids.  There was plenty of space between the two full size beds.  The bathroom could use an update but it's not a big deal.  Also, the heater made an annoying ticking sound throughout the night.  The staff was very friendly and provided great service.  I really like that they had an indoor pool.  It's only 3.5 ft deep so it's perfect for young kids.  There's also a nice Jacuzzi.  Great workout facility too!  There's a Crepe stand right down the street that you should check out if you stay here.  It's literally a 30 second walk.
review.positiveRemarks: Pool, gym, comfy beds. Friendly staff
review.negativeRemarks: fix that ticking sound from the heater and have some pool toys for kids to play with at the pool.
review.locationRemarks: Union square is within walking distance, good amount of restaurants in the area.

review.title: long walk and outdated
review.reviewText: was meant to have 2 queens beds , and room smelt when went down stairs asked about room expedia had ordered wrong room that was on itinerary , but that I said was ok we'd stay in that room we went out and returned found we were locked out and our room changed to lower floor .
review.negativeRemarks: could do with updated room , room smelt of moth balls
review.locationRemarks: its a long walk to downtown and quality food

review.title: Great Hotel, Great Staff!
review.reviewText: From the moment we arrived we were taken care of in a way that made us feel special. All of their associates are friendly, kind and accomodating.
review.negativeRemarks: The pool area is a bit disappointing. Needs outdoor lighting.
review.locationRemarks: So close to all of the shopping, Union Square, etc. And easy to walk to any other transportation.

review.title: Nice hotel for an overnight stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Loved the hotel and location.  Great that you have underground parking but a little expensive!  Breakfast and waiter was excellent but again a little costly and not included in the room rate.  

Very disappointed about the bar facilities and bar staff, we came back from meeting friends well before 11pm and the bar man told us he was already shut and to go to an off license as room service was also already over - this is unacceptable in my opinion, not so much not being able to get a night cap but his attitude behind the bar on a Saturday night in a big city!!!!
review.positiveRemarks: Central to Union Square and the 60th party we were attending that night
review.negativeRemarks: Free parking or at least cheaper than $50+ dollars a night!!!

review.title: Financial District
review.reviewText: It was an enjoyable stay the staff were really informative.  The only thing they could work on is the $54 a night parking fee that's ridiculous.

review.title: Very nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel comfy and clean to stay with but not a great location you need to drive everywhere. Valet parking only and quite expensive

review.title: Fan fest
review.reviewText: Hotel is close to AT&T park so we walked very easy walk. Easy off and back on hwy 101 bay bridge which is a plus. Very friendly staff. Starbucks in the front lobby
Great hotel. Good location for business needs near financial district.
review.negativeRemarks: Entirely too expensive.

review.reviewText: It was within walking distance of the convention center. Easy parking. Will stay again.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your stay! Your feedback and comments are important to us and appreciated. I was surprised to learn that our pool was too cold as we maintain a standard water temperature of 82 degrees F year round. We apologize if the temperature did not meet your expectations and was too cold. Our maintenance staff checks this numerous times throughout the day.
Also, our apologies for not having the right amount of towels for the number of guests in your room. Our standard is to provide 3 full sets of terry in our rooms with a king bed and 4 sets in our queen/queen rooms. We are always happy to provide more towels upon request at any time day or night. Thank you for making us aware of the sofa bed mattress as we do replace these whenever needed.
Unfortunately, we are not able to offer self-park at this hotel as all of our parking space is located within the building and requires valet attendants to navigate the limited and enclosed space that we have. Parking rates are high in the city and we do regularly compare our prices to our competitors in order to remain competitive.
Once again, thank you for your review and for staying with us.

review.title: Not what I expected
review.reviewText: The room was extremely small for 4 people. If I paid full price of over $500 I would be extremely upset. Indoor pool was freezing. 3 towels for a 4 person room. Fold out couch mattress looked dirty. Valet was only option to park car which they price gouged at $54/ night... Uncool to do that to your guests. Disappointed but we didn't let it ruin the weekend.

review.title: One night in downtown SF
review.reviewText: Stayed for a single night prior to flying out of the US. Good downtown location with comfy and clean rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing stands out.
review.locationRemarks: Two blocks to Market St, plenty of cafes and restaurants all around.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: I have stayed at this hotel several times, but this is my first review.  The hotel is walking distance to just about everything.  It is clean, the staff is great.  It is the typical Courtyard Marriott experience... great!
Great stay. Will stay here again if I need to spend the night in the city.

review.title: Nice hotel Minutes from the warf.
review.reviewText: Hotel was great, only thing that could've been better is if the Sbux at the hotel didn't close at noon. Apparently this hotel is in the financial district so since big executives don't work Sat/Sun Sbux doesn't either.

review.title: Wonderful overall!
review.reviewText: The ONLY issue is the valet parking cost. $54 per day seems a bit much.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Only thing with the room was it was to warm had to have the air on constantly

review.title: Good location for New Years eve
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice. Bar and grill inside as well as an Starbucks. A liquor store across the street was nice too. Kit suite was enough room to host and sleep two couples.

review.title: Nice hotel to stay
review.reviewText: Very nice. Only complain is the parking is expensive.

review.title: Very clean and comfortable room
review.reviewText: Stayed overnight and saw a show at the Orpheum theater. 10 min cab ride there.
Good location, great staff, great food... definitely recommend

The overall stay of the hotel was amazing but on our last day, we asked the front desk to reserve our names for the airport shuttle and after giving all of our information when the time came, the shuttle never showed up and a different attendee told us that we never made a reservation. This cost us to be late and have to take a much more expensive cab to the airport. Aside from this mishap, everything else was spectacular.

review.title: Nice downtown hotel
review.reviewText: We had a nice stay at the Courtyard Marriott.  Parking is ridiculously high, so I parked down the street under the freeway ramp and walked a few blocks. Well worth the walk.  Felt pretty safe walking on 2nd street.  My daughter and I loved the Starbucks in the lobby. We also enjoyed the outdoor fire pit after a long, busy day.  Valet guys were extra nice and helpful.  I thought the walk to Union Square would be closer, but it's a long walk.  We did not eat at the hotel restaurant. It would have been nice to have a complimentary continental breakfast. Overall, we had a nice stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Include a complimentary breakfast and reduced parking rate.
review.locationRemarks: The location was on a safe street. We walked to St. Patrick's church on Sunday and attended mass. Market street is a few blocks down near Embarcadero.

review.title: 1st visit to San Fran
review.reviewText: Loved it!! Everything was great! It was our first time visiting San Francisco, so we decided to stay right in the middle of everything. After discovering all these new places, we realized we really enjoyed being by fishermans wharf. Hotel was great though!! Very friendly staff.  We got a 1 bedroom suite upgrade simply bc we asked and there's was one available! Will def be back!!!

review.title: amazing
review.reviewText: Perfect  trip all the way around only downside is the hotel Starbucks is literally the worst slowest branch I've ever been too.

review.title: Female Business Traveler
review.reviewText:
I would highly recommend the Courtyard Marriott downtown San Francisco!  The staff was incredibly helpful with guidance for walking/running routes in the neighborhood as well as transportation and dining inquiries.
I had room service the first night and was please with both the quality and the service.  The outdoor patio bar is an excellent place to unwind.
I will definitely stay here again.

review.title: Customer Service
review.reviewText: Staff was what made it such a pleasurable experience
review.negativeRemarks: Jazz up the rooms a little
review.locationRemarks: Good location for shopping

review.title: Excellent location to Union Square
review.reviewText: Excellent customer service, very responsive and willing to go above and beyond.

review.title: In business district away from tourism attractions
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, with average but clean rooms. Very comfortable. Busy streets in crowded financial district. For those who like walking, Chinatown, North Beach, Fisherman's Wharf are a nice but long outing on foot. You may want to cab back later. Fire pit is a fun place to hang out with a drink and meet fellow travelers. The Fly Trap bar and restaurant around the corner on Folsom St. is an excellent, intimate place to drink and dine. Only complaint was price -- this being San Francisco. $300-plus a night is exorbitant for a typical hotel room, but apparently is the norm for the city.
review.negativeRemarks: Lower rates for tourists.
review.locationRemarks: Busy financial district near Bay Bridge. Not a lot for tourists to see nearby. Attractions are a long walk or a cab ride. Cable cars are not too far.

review.title: Great experience. Helpful staff. Close to shopping
review.reviewText:
Very friendly staff. Attractive room. We enjoyed that it was close to shopping and several different types of cuisine.
We would definitely stay there again. Very clean hotel with a nice bar and Starbucks Coffee.
review.positiveRemarks: It was a very nice place and so close to everything!
review.negativeRemarks: Would be nice to have a small breakfast offered to guests.
review.locationRemarks: We went shopping and out to dinner at many different places in the area. All were very nice and found a nice wine bar!

review.reviewText:
This is my experience. This is my experience.This is my experience.
This is my experience.

review.title: Comfortable
review.reviewText: Friendly, helpful front desk staff. Comfy, clean rooms. Pricey parking.

Great hotel in the center of everything.  The staff is very accommodating and friendly.  The rooms are very large for a city hotel.  I have stayed here several times this year while in San Francisco and always had everything I needed.  The price is high - but so is everything in that area - but the Marriott is competitive.  I would definitely recommend.

review.title: Close to Market Street and easy access to trams et
review.reviewText: Hotel staff were very welcoming and helpful indeed. We didn't once have breakfast at the hotel because it seemed too expensive so couldn't comment on that. I would recommend The Grove on Mission Street for a lovely breakfast. The pool was nice to have available, though much smaller than anticipated!

review.title: Marriot near the park
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel, has a Starbucks right in the lobby. Walking distance to AT&T park. Several good restaurants with in walking distance also

review.title: Great hotel ,good location
review.reviewText: Great clean hotel with good facilities. Staff friendly and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: Free wi fi, a definite attraction.
review.negativeRemarks: Personnel safes in the room would have been nice

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: Is a good hotel to stay. Love it.. I will come back one day..

review.title: July Gamer Babes
review.reviewText: The Courtyard is so convenient because it's close to the AT&T Park and is located within walking distance to many great eateries and stores. The staff is always helpful to make our stay very comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly and helpful staff, good food and beverage selections, and spacious room.
review.locationRemarks: Close to AT&T Park, the Embarcadero, Fisherman's Wharf and shopping on Market Street.

review.title: Close to AT@T Park.
review.reviewText: Valet parking was not great. It's not easy being forgotten twice when your paying $54 per trip.

review.title: Happy Giants fan.
review.reviewText: We really liked the hotel.  Nothing fancy but clean, quiet, nice courtyard, Starbucks on site.  Convenient to many SF attractions.
review.positiveRemarks: We loved the outdoor courtyard with the fireplace.  Very relaxing place to go after the Giants game.
review.negativeRemarks: The bed was a bit squeaky on one side.
review.locationRemarks: Great location for the Giants game, Union Square, Embarcadero.

review.reviewText: We had a pleasant experience at the Courtyard, the staff were very friendly, the food was great and the location was very safe and convenient for meetings, shopping and sightseeing.
Overall, it's a good experience and the location is good.  I would recommend this hotel to my friends and family.

review.title: Located within walking distance of Wharf...nice!
review.reviewText: We had a great time in San Francisco.  After a long day of walking San Fran we got into the hot tub and pool and it was heaven!
review.positiveRemarks: Clean rooms, friendly front desk and valet service
review.negativeRemarks: A continental breakfast to start our day out right to tour San Francisco.  Not having this we went without breakfast longer than we would have liked.
review.locationRemarks: Walked to Wharf, China town, Union Square, local parks,Walgreen's down two blocks down. Visited St. Patrick church

review.title: Perfect for our family
review.reviewText:
Very comfortable beds and pillows. The 24 hour store in the lobby is handy.

We were happy with the free basic Wifi, and faster internet is available for a price. I like this system much better than normal hotels that force you to pay for a wifi connection.
review.negativeRemarks: Only valet parking on site, which costs $54 per day. A cheaper self park option would be nice. Would also be nice if you could open the windows.
review.locationRemarks: The location is a bit off the beaten path, but there is a bike share station right across the street. Easy walk to Market Street.

review.title: Great location and super clean!
review.reviewText: My husband and I and our two teenagers stayed here and it was great. Very clean, pool, starbucks inside and the staff were so nice. Would have liked a refrigerator in the room, and breakfast was an additional 20 per person but that is common when in the city. Parking was 52 a day so we rode buses and cable cars, it was in a convenient location.

review.title: We'll surely choose this hotel again the next time
review.reviewText: Staff are very friendly and helpful, we have a pleasant stay of 3 days.
review.positiveRemarks: The location of the hotel is convenient to everywhere, the room is spacious and clean, not really new but well maintained.
review.locationRemarks: A couple of blocks to shopping, dining, museum.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. Please accept my sincere apologies for failing to provide you with the room type you reserved and for the discomfort this caused you and your colleague. I can only imagine how awkward this must have been for both of you. Please know that I have discussed this situation with our Rooms Department Leadership and counselled them on how to respond to situations such as this in the future. Thank you again for notifying us of your experience. I hope you will give us another opportunity to have you as our guest again in the future. Debbie Bonafede, General Manager.

review.title: Not what I ordered
review.reviewText:
I was traveling with a male companion who was not my husband, I paid the extra $30 for two queen beds. Upon arrival the staff did not see I had already paid in full, tried to charge me twice, then gave me my room. When we arrived it was one king bed. I returned to the desk to find that they had given our reservation away and had NO double rooms left. as it was very late in the night I was forced into an uncomfortable awkward situation of sharing the bed. This is not appropriate, or professional. 
To add insult to injury they were unable to refund the difference in the cost for the two rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Attention to detail.
review.locationRemarks: There was a good restaurant for breakfast about half a mile down the road.

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: My husband and I were traveling with our 2 kids, 8&11. We were attending an event at AT&T park and wanted a hotel within walking distance. Also wanted 2 queen beds because the kids are getting bigger and dont like to share. (they still have to- but i try to get them a big bed )Dropped the car off early (10:30am) and walked to the park. They actually offered us a room if we wanted to check in then, but we had reserved a room with a view and really just wanted to drop our luggage and get going. Came back after the event and got our luggage and checked in. Good service. Room was decent, comfortable beds. Valet service Sunday morning was quick. I would definately stay again if we were attending another event at AT&T park. There was a Chevys nearby which we went to for dinner. Not much further there was a target which was great since my son didn't bring a sweater. Anyway, it was expensive, but that's what you have to expect given the great location.

review.title: Awesome!
review.reviewText: Had a great experience with this hotel. .. Highly recommend it...

managementResponses.response: Thank you for taking time to review our hotel. I am very happy to know that you enjoyed your stay with us and found the accommodations pleasing, comfortable and convenient. I was most pleased to read that you found our staff helpful and friendly. I will be sure to share your kind comments with Kirk and see that he is recognized. It was also nice to learn that you enjoyed our food & beverage offerings and that you liked our new courtyard fireplace. Thank you for staying with us and I hope that your travel back home was smooth and uneventful.

review.title: Pleasantly Surprised
review.reviewText: We recently stayed at the Marriott Courtyard Downtown San Francisco as part of a family trip to America and was pleasantly surprised at its pleasing interior of the communal areas. The hotel looks plain & functional from the outside but inside the interior design and décor is much more pleasing on the eye. There is a lovely courtyard area for drinks and food with an impressive & attractive gas burner for the evenings. The rooms are functional with comfortable beds and the breakfast choice is very good. The bar menu although limited was varied with good sized portions. The staff were very helpful and friendly, especially Kirk, one of the waiters. We were a family of four adults in two rooms and our rooms were next to each other with interconnecting doors.
review.positiveRemarks: The attractive and comfortable communal areas especially the courtyard with its outdoor heaters.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms were a little plain in their décor.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is within walking distance (25 mins aprox) or a short tax ride to the piers and The Embarcardo.

review.title: G.m. exelent uvication
review.reviewText: Confort and exellent uvication, quiet , need t.v.open its only for pay?

managementResponses.response: Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback regarding your stay. I am pleased that you enjoyed our hotel and the location. Our proximity to AT&T Park is a great feature. Our parking prices, although may seem high, are comparable to most other hotel parking rates in San Francisco and in some cases are lower. We are sensitive to parking rates and therefore, are continually monitoring our competitor’s rates in an effort to remain competitive and not over charge our guests. Again, thank you for your comments and your business.

review.title: $60 parking? Ridiculous.
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Close to AT&T. Love the atmosphere. But $60 to park? Not again.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your responses regarding your recent stay with us. I am happy to hear that you enjoyed our hotel. I was especially pleased to hear that you found our staff to be friendly and accommodating and that your room was clean. Thank you for the recommendation and for staying with us!

review.title: Close and comfortable
review.reviewText: Excellent location, friendly front desk staff, great housekeeping staff, room was clean but plainly decorated, nice pool and exercise facilities, would stay again.
review.positiveRemarks: The front desk staff greeted every guest as they entered.
review.negativeRemarks: Room decor could be updated.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to all Market Street tourist attractions. Close to streetcars, cable cars, and BART trains, easy to get to and from airport via BART

review.title: Nice and close to att park
review.reviewText: Staff very respectful and helpful. Rooms where comfortable Staff knowledgable about city

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your nice comments about your recent stay with us. We are very glad to know that your arrival and dining experiences were positive. Thank you for staying with us and for your recommendation!

review.reviewText: This was a quick check in as I had a business meeting to attend. Staff was very quick and courteous. The restaurant was great with their buffet. Would easily stay here again.

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText: Convenient location in the middle of downtown SF. Unpretentious. Good breakfast with many options.

review.title: Great price and location, decent hotel
review.reviewText: Centrally located, just blocks away from Union Square, AT&T Park, SOMA; with easy access to mass transport. Hotel is pretty basic, but clean and simple. Pool is OK, nothing to write home about and a bit crowded. Parking is ridiculously expensive...a watch-out for those on a budget.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. Please accept my sincere apologies for the confusion regarding parking rates as well as the delay in the retrieval of your car. Be assured I have discussed this situation with our valet contractor and we will ensure all parking staff are fully training on both hourly and overnight parking rates. Thank you again for sharing your feedback. Debbie Bonafede, General Manager.

review.title: Don't park here!
review.reviewText: Got a noise complaint for music being played on a phone which really cannot go loud. Got told three different incorrect prices for parking. Had to wait Forty minutes to get the car out because they had to move cars around it to "get it out" which is ridiculous. The car was only parked for about 4 hours and got charged a full overnight charge.
review.negativeRemarks: The valet staff

review.title: Fantastic hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: Stayed here from April 10th thru April 14th & honestly couldn't fault this hotel. It is spotlessly clean, delicious breakfast, free fast wifi, safes at reception, perfect location & the best staff. Nothing was a problem for them & they went out of their way to be helpful & friendly without being in your face. The evening food was very good & good value. I couldn't recommend this hotel enough we had a briiiant stay.

review.title: It was a wonderful but parking too expensive
review.reviewText: We really liked the hotel- rooms clean, friendly staff, terrific breakfast & reasonably priced but the price for parking was outrageous with no for warning. This alone would might keep me from returning.

review.title: Good location nice breakfast & pool costly parking
review.reviewText:
Overall nice hotel in quiet area (2nd street). Walking distance 5-10minutes to Union square, cable-car, F-line, and BART. There's a good choice of restaurants on the same street, ranging from a Subway and Meditterranean to Indian and Thai food. Kid friendly. Hotel staff is very friendly.

Room was clean and quiet (8th floor). Beds are on the soft side, 2 types of pillow sizes and firmness.

In our room, the sink area was outside of the bathroom and although hidden from sleeping area, turning on the light (for example to shave early in the morning or brush teeth late at night) would brighten up the sleeping room as well, which was not ideal when someone else was already or still asleep. TV in room is ok, not all channels are digital (somewhat limited choice if you're using your hotel stay to catch up on TV shows; only main HBO channel is available).

Nice breakfast buffet spread includes a to-order omelet/egg/waffle station (in addition to scrambled eggs and bacon), good assortment of cut fruit, bread, 5 cereal types, pastries, milk, porridge and yoghurt. Waiting staff is very friendly. The breakfast package with room was a good option.

Pool (3ft deep) and spa were clean and are in a room on the 2nd floor that has windows to inside patio and gym. It is an enjoyable place to hang out (not in windowless basement). There are water fountains with chilled water.

Parking in hotel is very expensive, we chose a valet parking, 15min walk away
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is expensive. For longer term stay (3-4 days) much cheaper valet parking is available 15 minutes walk away.
review.locationRemarks: walking distance to BART, cable car, streetcar (all on Market), several restaurant options in the street

review.title: Good place to stay.
review.reviewText:
It was very comfortable stay, whenever I asked staff a question of how to get to a place they answered very nicely !:)
Great place to go to.

review.title: Great hotel downtown, great for work traveler
review.reviewText: Standard and solid experience. Concierge desk was helpful and it's location really couldn't be beat. I will stay there every time I'm in SF - only knock on them is a real lack is a business center

review.title: Great hotel downtown, great for work traveler
review.reviewText: Standard and solid experience. Concierge desk was helpful and it's location really couldn't be beat. I will stay there every time I'm in SF - only knock on them is a real lack is a business center

review.title: Snow 5 Show
review.reviewText: From the minute we arrived in the driveway the staff met us with smiles and was ready to help. We were able to get an early check in which was great.
review.locationRemarks: Metreon

review.title: Fun in San Fran
review.reviewText: Loved the close proximity to AT&T park

review.title: Good
review.reviewText: The house take away my zippos. After I called the front desk, they sent it back.

review.title: Nice hotel in all respects
review.reviewText: Good positive experience. I'll stay there. again .

review.title: Downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Good locale for accessing all of San Fran.
All forms of transportation are easily accessible.... Bus/Bart / cabs, and the newer lift network...

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Excellent

review.title: Great location and walking distance to everything!

review.reviewText: Hotel staff was very friendly. It was a little far to walk, with suitcases, to Montgomery BART stop. Was told that it was only 3 blocks, but they were big blocks. We were there on a Sunday and had difficulty finding an open breakfast place, since we didn't want to pay $20 for the breakfast at the hotel.This hotel is more in the business district, so Monday morning was a lot different...lots of choices then. Discovered the Starbucks on Monday morning. Quiet location, beds very comfortable. Would stay here again, just pack a little lighter!
review.positiveRemarks: Free internet, comfortable beds, sink outside of shower and toilet, and big windows. Close enough to Union Square shopping area.
review.negativeRemarks: Include breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: Quiet area. Within walking distance to Union Square shopping area.

review.title: Overpriced and far from all of the attractions
review.reviewText:
We stayed in this Marriott Courtyard for one night only and had mixed feelings.
We arrived around 1pm and the room was not available since the check in is supposed to be at 3 pm. It was ok with us especially they promised to call us when it would be ready so we went to explore the city. Nobody called us and around 7:30pm we came back and checked in the room that was two queen bed one instead of one king with a sofa bed that was originally promised. The room was clean but nothing special, just a three ( not 4!) star hotel room. This hotel is overpriced and location is not conviniet at all. It is too far from everything ( by walking) and parking is too expensive if you prefer to drive. Some people wrote that it is located in the quiet area but we didn't find that area charming or attractive. Next time we'll just stay at Marquise or in Union Square Marriott. It's almost the same price but closer to everything and definitely more attractive hotels.

review.title: No circus peanuts in the minibar
review.reviewText: I had a pretty great experience except for one little naggy thing, which was the minibar did NOT have any of those tasty orange circus peanuts. I can't bring any along through my carry-on due to TSA regulations so I was really looking forward to having some and was dismayed when I opened up my minibar and didn't find any. Overall I'd rate my stay 4 out of 5, the one tick due to circus peanuts.
review.negativeRemarks: stock circus peanuts
review.locationRemarks: good restaurants and roads near by

review.title: 2 nights $534 Not worth it
review.reviewText: No words. I know I should have used my resort membership. well live and learn right.
review.negativeRemarks: Be more aware of the cleaning ex: curtains sheets etc.
review.locationRemarks: ok

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: Grest people but expensive parking overall great time good drinks and food

review.title: Great Staff
review.reviewText: The staff was very welcoming and took care of our needs immediately. The hotel is in a great location close to the ballpark and great restaurants.

review.title: Nice hotel in good location in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Nice hotel and hotel staff - it's a big chain so while the room and hotel are nice - don't expect anything extra (without of course, paying an arm and a leg for it).

A few things:

No refrigerator in the room - at these prices - it should come with a walk in cold box.

$52.00 a day for valet parking? Granted, this is San Francisco - an expensive city to live/visit but still ridiculous. Save your money and find parking on one of the side alley streets.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff and clean, comfortable room.
review.negativeRemarks: Refrigerators in the room and less expensive valet/parking.
review.locationRemarks: Great downtown location - quick walk to all of San Francisco's downtown attractions and public transportation.

review.title: Clean hotel away from noise of the city.
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay here! The front desk staff was very helpful in explaining how to get around the city. They gave us a map and highlighted possible places to visit and places to eat. On the first night our air conditioner was not working, but the front desk staff sent someone right up to fix it. On the second night the air conditioner stopped working again, so they immediately offered us another room. This hotel is a short distance Union Square, but it's easily in walking distance to the major attractions in the city.

review.title: Reasonable value for San Fran
review.reviewText: Hotel is close to Market St, Financial District and transportation. Staff were courteous and friendly. Some upgrades to room are needed but it was comfortable and quiet.
review.negativeRemarks: Couch in room was worn and appeared dirty.

review.title: No surprises - just a solid and pleasant hotel
review.reviewText:
I stayed here for four nights at the start of a holiday in San Francisco. It's what you'd expect from a large chain hotel. The welcome was friendly and helpful, they met my room requests and gave me advice and maps about the local area without my having to ask.

The room was spacious and clean, with a view of the Bay Bridge. It was very quiet.

The location is excellent, halfway between Market and AT&T park - about 10 minutes walk from each. It's a bit pricey but then most things in SF are. I'd definitely stay here again.

Despite the obvious chain feel about the hotel, the courtyard area seemed nice and the bar/restaurant appeared pleasant though I didn't actually use it. There's a minimart directly across the street which is quite useful and a Starbucks and small shop for essentials in the lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: A bit pricey
review.locationRemarks: Excellent for AT&T park, downtown, Embarcadero.

review.title: Convenient to ATT Park
review.reviewText: Staff was very nice and room very clean. Breakfast in the morning was a nice buffet w/egg and omelet station.
review.locationRemarks: ATT park is a short walk down 2nd street. Great place to stay if you are coming from out of town for a Giants game.

review.title: 4th of July
review.reviewText: We stayed at the hotel over the 4th of July, the hotel was extremely busy but the staff was wonderful.
review.locationRemarks: Location was great, we went on a dinner cruise from Pier 3 and were able to walk to and from.

review.title: Easy walk to AT&T Park
review.reviewText: We chose this hotel because of it's walking distance location to AT&T Park. It's an easy walk with a lot of other folks walking to the Giants game also. Cafes and bars along the walk if you are so inclined. This is an extremely busy hotel during baseball season with people checking in and out simultaneously. The staff does their best but it can get a bit hectic. We had to wait for 4 elevators before we could get down from our room at 10:30 am. Also, there is no late night food service. Overall, it is a nice hotel, friendly staff, and perfect walk to see the Giants play.

review.title: Perfect for San Francisco!
review.reviewText: Its location in the Financial District makes it perfect. It is only a few blocks from Market Street, where you can take the bus to Fishermans Wharf (5 minutes). The hotel was impecable, with comfortable amenities and great service. Definitely would stay there on my next visit!
review.positiveRemarks: It is located near Market St where you can find many stores, shops, and the views are great!
review.negativeRemarks: We stayed in a standard room and had no safety box or fridge.
review.locationRemarks: Shop, eat and take the bus to a lot of great spots in San Francisco

review.title: Just OK
review.reviewText: This hotel is located close to downtown and is slightly cheaper than some of the hotels in the area, but I guess you get what you pay for. I found it to be fairly disappointing for a Marriott. The lobby/restaurant area downstairs is very nice, but the room was very old looking and small. My biggest issue was that the room did not come with a security safe (issue for business travelers) and did not come with a mini fridge (also not great for staying for a longer duration). Hotel staff was nice. All in all, so-so.
review.negativeRemarks: Update the rooms so they don't seem so old, and provide a safe and mini fridge in the rooms (basic things!)
review.locationRemarks: Very close to downtown, shopping, 21st Amendment Brewery

review.title: San Francisco Visit
review.reviewText: Good Hotel, good location. Clean rooms and friendly staffl

review.title: Good location. Nice Hotel.
review.reviewText: Stayed here with my family in May 2013. This is a very nice hotel. We never ate in the hotel, so cannot comment on the food. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Glad we had parking included in our hotel rate as it is steep, as in most major cities.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice separated bathroom (exterior sink). Good décor. Nice TV.
review.negativeRemarks: Would have liked a refrigerator in the room.
review.locationRemarks: Just blocks to the ball park. A few blocks to shopping and to the cable car to get to the Wharf.

review.title: Not downtown but just as nice.
review.reviewText:
We were earlier than the posted check-in time but our room was ready. I did not think until our stay was almost over to inquire about a chair next to the tub for my 93 year old mother. The tub did not have non-skid strips for older people and it was difficult to feel comfortable getting in and out even though there was a hold bar. Another one at the other end of the tub may help. I would also request a firmer mattress next time and since the hotel was accommodating in other areas, I 'm sure that they can fulfill my request if I request at the time of my reservation.

Easy to get around town without the crowds. Public transportation within steps of the door and easy walk to Union Square and the Ferry Building.

Courtyard Marriott was recommended by family members and I will definitely by staying there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant noise level.
review.locationRemarks: Easy walking distance everywhere but handy to public transportation.

review.title: Great hotel for the price!!

The hotel is very clean, good service, and they have computer with internet at the lobby that tou can use, free wi-fi in the rooms, gym and pool a little smalls, but well it can be perfect for that price.
review.positiveRemarks: fruit flavored water in the lobby, nice touch

review.title: SF Trip to watch the Giants
review.reviewText: The hotel was perfect, it was very close to ATT Park, nice staff, very clean and considering the high hotel prices in SF it wasn't too bad.

review.title: Great business hotel.
review.reviewText: Did not feel like a 3 star hotel. Gret staff and confortable rooms. If you are driving, get the free valet parking with your room.
review.positiveRemarks: There is a starbucks next to the loby
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Couple blocks from main downtown areas and only a couple minutes from bay bride

review.title: Close to the ballpark
review.reviewText: Great place to stay if you're headed to a Giants game.

review.title: Excellent experience at this hotel!
review.reviewText: I was impressed from the start as I walked into hotel lobby at about 830 pm on evening of check in to be greeted by 30ish year old guy having meltdown in lobby regarding his room not being what he needed and not wanting to share bed with his business partner who apparently weighs 300 pounds. The ability of the staff to deal with this "gentlemen" was quite impressive as I was about to tell him to grow up and stop yelling at everyone so that he could be "helped". While keeping my mouth shut-- I was able to still checkin within just a few minutes and found my room to be excellent and hotel amenities just what I needed for my education/business trip. Stayed 5 nights and very easy walking distance to excellent restaurants, the Moscone Convention Center and all sorts of shopping experiences. Thanks for such a pleasant stay.

review.title: Great hotel for all
review.reviewText: The hotel is very centrally located. The staff have been extremely friendly and helpful. I reached early and they assigned a room before the check in time. The concierge has been of great help. People managing the valet parking were very helpful. The restaurant ( Whispers? ) had limited menu, but food was very tasty. The buffet breakfast was elaborate and gets you ready for the whole day. I certainly would like to go back to this hotel.

review.title: nice place
review.reviewText: had a few minor issues but they were quickly resolved

review.title: Great hotel near ATT Park!
review.reviewText: The room was very spacious! It was nice and clean.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: Great location near ATT Park

review.title: San Francisco
review.reviewText: My husband and I traveled with 2 children ages 2 and 6. Our room was a standard with 2 queen beds. The beds were very uncomfortable for us, soft and a little lumpy. I guess if you like that type of bed, you would love them! The staff was tentative to the needs of our family. Be ready to pay $47.00 a day for valet parking. There is no street parking that is close to the hotel, except meter parking.
review.locationRemarks: Close to cable cars and buses to travel around the city, Fisherman's warf and Chinatown about a mile from the hotel.

review.title: pros and cons
review.reviewText:
Everything was great except for a few things: The pool looks very nice in the picture, so its disappointing to see a below average pool in person; The front desk staff doesn't know much about the area; parking is 60$.
The bed is comfortable! room is nice and clean! minus the parking fee, its a reasonable price for a nice hotel. I recommend it.
review.positiveRemarks: bed is comfortable, hotel in nice overall
review.negativeRemarks: pool looks better in the picture. So seeing it in person is a little disappointing at first.
review.locationRemarks: The location is great for people that do not mind walking. We liked the location

review.title: Eh it was ok
review.reviewText: Rooms were bland and felt like a cheap motel room. 335 dollars a night, uncool

review.title: Nice hotel, good deal - no big complaints!
review.reviewText: Two friends and I shared a room with a king-sized bed. It was a clean and pretty spacious room, and the bathroom was a decent size. We had a good view of the Financial District. The staff was friendly and helpful. We didn't eat any food from the hotel so I can't comment on it. They let us leave our luggage behind the desk for a couple of hours after we checked out. The hotel's parking was a ridiculous $47 per night, so we left our cars for the weekend in a really cheap lot a few blocks away that only ended up being $22 for three nights! Amazing deal! The sink was a little cramped right next to the bathroom door, and the only issue we had with service was waiting over an hour to get a blanket after we asked for it over the phone. The hotel was in a pretty good location, within walking distance of Union Square and the Embarcadero. Not too many homeless people on the streets so the walk isn't too unsafe. There's plenty of good restaurants in the area. I would recommend this hotel to fellow student travelers, and probably to anyone else wanting to stay in this area, as long as you get a good deal for the room like we did. It's definitely up to par with the Marriott status.
review.positiveRemarks:
Nice, clean room
Pretty quiet
Helpful staff
Good access to the rest of the city
review.negativeRemarks: Parking would have been outrageous at $47 per night
review.locationRemarks: Financial District: lots of residences and office buildings, but walking distance from Union Square and the Embarcadero

review.title: great hotel and location
review.reviewText: hotel was close to downtown without all the outside noise, rooms were very clean and comfortable. Could not beat the great rate during the week, i really enjoyed relaxing in the outdoor patio. Starbucks is right outside the hotel.

review.title: Worth it.... if you have the money.
review.reviewText: The hotel is beautiful, the room was clean, everything was great EXCEPT for all the hidden taxes and fees I was charged with. Sure, if you have the money to be spending $200+ a night then stay here, but for me, it was just too much. I saw this hotel for $149 per night on Expedia, so I thought that was a really good deal for the Marriott. When I arrived, however, there was no complimentary parking and my choices were valet at the hotel for $53 or $45 to park on the street. In addition, when I received my receipt, there were all these additional charges like "Tourism Tax," "State Tax," "Room Tax"... my overall total came out to nearly $100 more than I expected! It was a mess, and I could've stayed at a hotel just as nice for half the price.
review.negativeRemarks: PRICE
review.locationRemarks: Convenient. We walked to all of the places we wanted to see.

review.title: Very Good Choice
review.reviewText: Easy to reach from Highway, 10mins walk to city center. Very good restaurants suround. A liitle bit noise because it is located in the city and normal view from window. Price and staff are very good. Queen bed.

review.title: spacious and convenient,Great value for the money
review.reviewText: very nice home with easy walking distance to downtown places such as china town and union square. our two-bed room was very spacious and comfortable. starbucks located next to the lobby so can buy breakfast easily. Great value and the best courtyard marriot i've ever stayed
review.positiveRemarks: starbucks at lobby, free internet, location
review.negativeRemarks: selections at the hotel restaurant limited
review.locationRemarks: easy access to downtown attractions, not far from bus stop

review.title: Quality you expect from Marriott.
review.reviewText:
Pros: Large Rooms, Clean, Convenient Location.
Cons: Expensive Valet Parking, No refrigerator in room.

review.title: Expensive Parking
