Really Clean, good location. Really expensive parking ($50).
Good Wi Fi internet.
review.negativeRemarks: Parkink price
review.locationRemarks: Superb.

review.title: Conveniently located
review.reviewText: Conveniently located. We were able to walk to Piers and get great pictures before continuing on with our trip to San Francisco. Some difficulty finding direction on GPS for some reason.
review.negativeRemarks: price for over night parking
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Our stay at the Courtyard was a pleasant experience. The rooms were clean, the staff courteous and helpful. I would definitely come back again and recommend to friends and family.

review.title: Very good hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is very nice in a section of San Francisco that is not overly busy. It was good for a stay of several days, convenient to the Moscone Convention Center

review.title: Nice location downtown.
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel not far from Moscone center and Market Street.

review.title: Great hotel for first-time visitors.
review.reviewText: The staff at the hotel was excellent. This was our first time in San Francisco and we took public transportation everywhere we went. Thanks to the knowledgeable staff, we had no trouble getting where we wanted to be and back to the hotel. They know what areas to stay away from.
review.negativeRemarks: Price.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location; therefore, worth every penny.

review.title: No parking
review.reviewText: There is no parking except for valet for 45 dollars. This should be included in the room fee.
review.negativeRemarks: Expensive parking and hideous lobby decor
review.locationRemarks: No parking but close to AT&T park

review.title: Liked the location
review.reviewText: Even though the courtyard brand doesn't really cater to families ( no complimentary breakfast etc..) we enjoyed our stay. The location allowed us to walk most places(Union Square) or take a short cab ride in the downtown area(Fishermans wharf). The valet parking service while pricy was very efficient and the valet's themselves were very helpful with directions. The Starbucks in the lobby was very much appreciated by this family of coffee drinkers.
review.negativeRemarks: lack of food options

review.title: Nice stay!
review.reviewText: Nice and friendly staff. Room was clean and comfy. Hotel has bar and grill, Cafe with breakfast buffet, and attached Starbucks!
review.negativeRemarks: Parking fees were high.

review.title: Overnight after event at Moscone Center
review.reviewText: This hotel is the perfect location for spending the night after a game at ATT Park or seeing a show at the YBCA. The room is comfortable. It was stuffy when we arrived but we opened the window to get a nice cool breeze to air it out. The bathrooms are not fancy but very functional. Loved having Starbucks in the lobby so we could get a quick breakfast. Fitness Center is small so you needed to time your visit if you wanted to use the stationary bicycle.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is great. Starbucks in lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: Large group arrivals made using the elevators a challenge.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for going to ATT Park or Moscone Center or shopping on Market Street

review.title: disappointing
review.reviewText: the bar always seemed to be closed along with the restaurants. the pool was inside and the room was very stuffy, no body was in it.

review.title: Conveinient for Giants games
review.reviewText: Very convenient hotel if you are attending a SF Giants game. You can walk to AT&T Park in 10 minutes. Very pleasant staff and good restaurant.
review.positiveRemarks: Upper floor room views are great
review.negativeRemarks: Lower floors room view is not great
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient for AT & T Park and Giants fans!

review.title: Baseball game stay
review.reviewText: Really baddddd view. Noisey next to elevader! Will not stay here again. Will tell people not to stay here.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise, small room for the price

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: We didn't rent a car because the overnight charge of $80 left us with an unfavorable review. In contrast, we stayed at a HOJO near the airport at half the price, complimenary continental breakfast, FREE underground parking, close to the airport, FREE shuttle service between the htl and airport, refrig and microwave, and the rooms were just as nice and clean !!!

review.title: Good location. Expensive for what it is.
review.reviewText: Location was good for San Francisco Half Marathon. But staff directed us to the wrong location for check-in/ Marathon Expo. There were many runners at the hotel and staff seemed to have no knowledge of marathon events. It would have been nice for hotel to have run a shuttle to start point. Instead, we had to walk over a mile each direction before and after the race. Room was very tight. With the sofa bed pulled out, we barely had room to walk around the king bed. Our room was expensive and on top of it we had to pay $51.00 dollars for parking. We asked about less expensive parking and were directed to another lot on the corner. We were told they charged $25.00 per day. Well, they didn't. It was $45.00 a day. So, we ended up parking at the hotel. On top of it, marathon events began at 5:30 in the morning on Saturday and the Starbucks in the hotel didn't open until 7:00. It would have been nice for the Starbucks to have been open earlier for family members. Again, it would have been nice for the hotel to have had some things more readily available for the marathon weekend. We travel a lot with our kids and have stayed at Courtyard Marriott in other places before. We just didn't think there was anything special about this particular property. Wouldn't stay here, again. Would stay further out and take BART into the city. We have done this before and prefer it to the stay we had here.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was good. Easy access to Bay Bridge/ Embarcadero/ Pier 39/ Chinatown, etc.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff not knowledgeable about large event/ activities. Staff not very helpful. Didn't go out of their way to find out answers. EXPENSIVE PARKING!
review.locationRemarks: Good location.

review.title: Issues every day
review.reviewText: We checked in on a Thursday and the AC turned off at night. The next day we decided to lower the temp on the ac and the power went out. It took them awhile to fix the outage. The ac never cooled at night for the rest of our stay. The next day the tv remote stopped working. The last day our toilet started over flowing and we had to call 3 times to have it fixed. The hotel did not even try to compensate us for all the issues.

review.title: Giants Fans looking to enhance a game day
review.reviewText: We were looking for a get away and a chance to see our favorite Baseball team. The service was great we were close enough to walk to the game. I would recomend this Hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: perfect only 4 blocks from At&t Park

review.title: Not exactly meant for tall people
review.reviewText:
standard height toilets are not comfortable for tall people, in addition there were no grab rails near the toilet. Having just had my knee replaced this was kind of a negative for me and more important as us baby boomers age.

Also, the height of the shower head was far lower than it could be - again, not exactly comfortable for tall people - upgrade to something adjustable.

The eating options seemd scattered - eat here at this time, eat there at that time and no coffee from starbucks after 4pm ? the "store" for miscellaneous items was far too limited to be worthwhile (not to mention way over priced).
review.positiveRemarks: the elevators, beverage and ice vending machines were not adjacent to any guest rooms - a definite pluss.
review.negativeRemarks: windows appeared to be able to open but laced screens or child guards - not good above the 1st floor, never mind the 15th.
review.locationRemarks: convenient to most of what we wanted

review.title: huge plus!
review.reviewText:
The hotel staff were extremely helpful. The only thing was the room was far from the elevator and little confusing to find your way otherwise enjoyed the overall stay.
The breakfast was a great plus. I looked through the downtown area I couldn't find any hotel that would offer breakfast but they had full service continental breakfast for just a few dollars more.
review.positiveRemarks: the breakfast was of great convenience to me.
review.negativeRemarks: the room was far from the elevator.
review.locationRemarks: the location was perfect.

review.title: Nice Hotel in Downtown SF
review.reviewText: No complaints. Nice hotel. Parking ($50) was a little pricey though.

review.title: poor bedcover status unmatched with new style room
review.reviewText:
Room was neither so bad nor so good .... Amenties, appliances, bathroom and carpet status were good. But bedcover status was lower than my expextation. it wasn't been ironed and washed well.

The staff service.... somebody was very kind and ready to serve for guest. But it seems like that somebody was just do their diligence.

review.title: Christmas in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
My son recently moved to San Francisco and my daughter lives in Los Angeles, (we live in Seattle) so my wife and I flew to frisco for Christmas and my daughter drove up. The hotel was very nice. For some reason it's hard to find 2 queen beds in frisco. We know that we wanted an indoor pool and hot tub so our choices were limited.

This hotel worked out very well. The pool area was very nice and inviting. Parking is expensive in San Francisco. Figure that into your stay. Two complaints. Breakfast is an $18 buffet but there are several places within walking distance.The other one is that you have to buy a newspaper on the weekends. Really?

I would stay there again though. Staff was friendly and helpful. Hotel was clean

review.title: Just OK
review.reviewText: Good hotel if staying for business.
review.locationRemarks: Hotels closer to Market Street and closer to Union Square.

review.title: The venue is perfect for any AT&T ballpark event.
review.reviewText: Excellent service and terrific hotel overall.
review.locationRemarks: Great for attending events at ATT ballpark. The indoor pool is a big hit with the kids.

review.title: great hotel to recommend
review.reviewText: it's a fantansic hotel to stay. very convenient and comfortable. it's in downtown, so a little bit expensive.

review.title: Great location for a Giants game!
review.reviewText: We were overall very impressed with the hotel. We were given the buffet breakfast as part of our hotel package, however, if we had had to pay for it (very overpriced), then I would have been pretty upset. Not even close to worth what they are charging. Seemed out of place considering the reputation of the hotel.

review.title: Great way to experience downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: This hotel was chosen for its location near AT&T park as my husband and I attended a Giants baseball game. Not only was it absolutely convenient (an easy walk to the park) but also so accessible to downtown San Francisco. Had we had more time, we would have stayed an extra night to ride the trolly around the city. Parking costs extra but our vehicle was kept safe in the underground garage because driving in downtown San Francisco really makes no sense. There are many choices of cafes and restaurants, pubs and coffee houses. Truly a fantastic time!

review.title: Highly recommended!
review.reviewText: The beds were really confortable, the room was really clean & the services (extra towels, guest information, etc) were great. It was a few blocks from Union Square & another popular locations. It is far if you want to be located near Alcatraz Island or Pier 39 but you can take a few busses or hop on - hop off busses to get there!

review.title: Good for Giant Game Fans
review.reviewText: Convient walking distance to the ballpark. Safe walking route after night games.

review.title: A very enjoyable experience
review.reviewText: This is the third year we've stayed at Courtyard Marriot for the San Francisco half marathon. Each time the rooms have been quiet, comfortable, well appointed. Staff has always been very helpful and courteous. The pool and hot tub area were a nice relaxing haven after the race. The hotel is near BART, some of our favorite eateries, the Embarcadero and Yerba Buena center area. Overall, a great spot for the weekend event.

review.title: SF Giants hotel
review.reviewText: If your looking for a great hotel really close to ATT park in San Francisco, this is the place. I walked to the ball park for 3 games, walked to Union Square, Chinatown, Fisherman's Wharf, and Goldengate park. Great hotel, great location.

review.title: Great Place
review.reviewText: great location, great staff, vey helpful. would definitely stay here again.

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText:
very comfortable rooms,
great choice!

review.title: Close to AT&T, friendly staff, nice hotel
review.reviewText: Enjoyed the stay, Convenient to city center, AT&T park, both walking distance. Walked to and from game, safe with kids.

review.title: Good all around
review.reviewText: Nice spacious room, well located, walking distance to everything including some great restaurants. Nothing extravagant but everything you need.

review.title: Great location much else...not so great
review.reviewText: I have to travel with medicine that needs refrigeration. Perhaps it's my fault but Marriott did not offer one in our room. Unfortunately I have become used to finding this amenity in virtually all rooms I have stayed in over the years at considerably less expense. Our luggage took over an hour to arrive in our room and we wanted to get out more quickly. They said that our names weren't on the luggage. Unfortuantely the overagressive folks asking if we wanted help with the luggage mentioned not a thing about this detail. I am accustomed to checking in first but the street setup here makes that difficult if not impossible. But this was the staff's error not mine. We were told we'd be provided a complimentary USA Today newspaper- but we received none. The breakfast is from 6 to 9:30. I know that everyone is cutting back expenses but that's a bit early for some of us who regard staying at a hotel as signifying a time one might sleep in. We had a King bed and a sofa bed. The sofa bed was disappointing to put it mildly. The staff also did not seem that adept at offering helpful advice- this seemed odd for a major hotel in downtown San Francisco. We were there to see a San Francisico Giants game and for this the location was great. Along with the fact that the room, facility was clean that's about all the praise I can give the Marriott Courtyard. I doubt I will ever stay there again.

review.title: Comfortable Accommodations in a Beautiful City
review.reviewText: Close to Moscone Center, terrific restaurants and bars. Very comfortable accommodations in a quiet location. Close enough to tourist and nightlife activities without being in the midst of noise, traffic, and crowds.

review.title: Good Visit
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our brief stay. My daughter and I felt safe and enjoyed the city. The hotel was clean and the staff was helpful. I would definately stay again.

review.title: Really Nice in Business District
review.reviewText: Great place, very nice. A little quite on weekends, seemed to be a M-F area. Nice pool and the staff throughout was great. The breakfast was a little pricey, but the attached Starbucks solved that problem; a latte and a snack to go.

review.title: Comfort with a business edge...
review.reviewText: I stayed for New Years, not the ideal hotel you think for an evening such as New Years. The hotel had its restrictions for the night very easily understood. Room was comfortable and location was perfect, I was only 2 blocks from the club I was going to...perfect. Valet is pricey, took a chance and parked on the street, ran out at 9am to feed the meter and get ready to leave by check out. Starbucks is in the lobby, cant ask for more. Great italian restraunts near by, a few good nightclubs in the area. This was my third visit to this hotel, I will return.

review.title: great value at affordable price
review.reviewText: the only thing i hate staying in SF is the compulsory valet parking. very expensive, advise to take account of it when choosing hotels in down town SF.

review.title: Whoo hoo
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel to stay at with my kids, they loved the indoor pool!!

review.title: It was very satisfiying
review.reviewText: Had a lot of fun in San Francisco and had a lot of peaceful rest Marriot

review.title: twas aight
review.reviewText:
Pros: Right near our desination, clean room, nice shower, front desk didnt bother us about bringing friends up, decent view, comfy couch, plenty of electrical outlets
Cons: overpriced, it was nice but not that nice... limited (5 minutes?!) music channels on tv,

review.title: I would go back again
review.reviewText: The only thing I didn't like was that the room doesn't have any refrigerator

review.title: Business Person's hotel
review.reviewText:
Definitely designed for the business traveler. The rooms have the TV to the side of the bed so it is uncomfortable to lay on the bed to watch and too far away to sit on the couch. The business center PCs were in the main lobby so everyone could shoulder-surf as you did your travel check-ins.

Food in restaurant was definitely overpriced unless you had a generous travel allowance.

Carpet in the room needed a shampoo because I could still smell the food a previous guest had dropped.

review.title: Better located hotels available in downtown San Francisco.
review.reviewText:
The hotel is fine - what you would expect from a Marriott Courtyard.
Good rooms and helpful staff.
But rather out of the way for tourist and entertainment, other than Moscone convention centre.
Parking at hotel ridiculously expensive.
Have stayed in more centrally located hotels at about same price and with better parking options.

review.title: Good stay for the price
review.reviewText: Decent location, easy to find much cheaper parking lot very close by, very satisfactory stay and comfortable beds.

review.title: Best Bet for Convenience, Price
review.reviewText: Overall the hotel was great: friendly/fast service, clean, quiet, and really close to great restuarants, AT&T park and only a $5 cab ride to Union Square. I really enjoyed my stay here. Some disadvantages: the pull out couch in the king bedroom was horrible, parking expenses through the hotel were bad, but that's about it. However, parking is easy to obtain nearby in other garages or on the street (we were able to park the entire visit on the street and didnt have to pay a dime)!

review.title: Thumbs up: SF Marriott Courtyard Downtown
review.reviewText: Prompt, courteous, efficient and friendly service. Provided maps and listings of neighborhood restaurants. I would stay here again and give it a top recommendation.

review.title: Great location if you need to visit the Mexican Consulate.
review.reviewText: Nice and clean hotel spacious room and frinedly staff

review.title: great location if you have business in the financial/downtown district
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice and would return if I have further business to do downtown.

review.title: Hotel for Professionals
review.reviewText: Courtesy staff always greeted us with a smile. The lobby and room were immaculate. Breakfast served was excellent. However, this hotel is not for the budget minded. One can easily find cheaper eats if necessary within walking distance.

review.title: Look forward to staying again!!
review.reviewText: Survey responses said it all. Everything was absolutely great and we will book again!!

review.title: Just about the best hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Great hotel, very highly recommended. Excellent service, ideal location, value for money though was still pricey but you'd easily find worse hotels for far more money.

The restaurant is a bit pricy and the food there could be better but again, service was excellent, and you're spoilt for choice as to what to eat and where with so many different cuisines within close proximity. Cosy little bar too, and having a Starbucks coffee shop is very convenient too.

I stayed there for a week and not once did I have any problems or felt there was something to complain about.

Location wise, ideal, far enough from Market St and Union Square not to hear anything but close enough to walk there in under 10 minutes.

review.title: Great location, not the best amenities.
review.reviewText: The hotel was in the perfect location to be connected to key parts of the city. The room was nice and overall the service was good. Two small things to point out: the gym and the pool should not be advertised as significant features in the hotel since neither of them is that great. Also, housekeeping, came earlier and earlier every morning. 8am is not an appropriate time to clean someone's room.

review.title: It was a place to stay
review.reviewText: Nothing great to say about this place, it was an average hotel with a terrible in-house restaurant. This area of San Francisco shuts down after 6 pm so be prepared to walk several blocks to find something decent to eat

review.title: Good business value for SFO
review.reviewText: Attended a conference at the Moscone in SFO. The Marriott is well located next to the Moscone Center, restaurants, coffee shops, and many more. It also has a deal with 24h Fitness located in the next building. Parking is not easy/economic in the neighborhood. Overall, a good choice for SFO visitors though. I´ll be back!

review.title: Very nice
review.reviewText: The hotel was within walking distance to everything, including AT&T Park. The room was big and the bed was very comfortable. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

review.title: Quality hotel in great downtown location
review.reviewText: We were very happy with our stay at the Marriott Courtyard Downtown SF. When we pulled into the check in area there were two employees ready to unload our vehicle and check our car as we chose the valet parking. When we asked for extra towels and washclothes they were courteous and prompt about getting them for us. The hotel is one of few downtown that has an indoor pool and hot tub. The lobby is spacious and comfortable to meet up with people or wait for your vehicle. The room was also spacious, clean and comfortable. The only negative about the room was that there was not a refrigerator so we had to use ice in our cooler pak and drain it each day. Although we were hesitant to pay for the valet parking it was worth having our car to explore areas outside of SF and they were prompt about bringing our car to us. The hotel cleans the bedding after every guest which was comforting to me after reading reviews of other hotels. We appreciated having a Starbucks in the hotel but they are not open in the evening. We ate at the restaurant at the hotel one night. It has a limited menu but the food was good. We were able to walk everywhere in the downtown SF area. We walked to the Wharf, Union square, Coit tower, china town and the dock to take the ferry to Alcatraz. This hotel was perfect for us!

review.title: San Francisco Spring Vacation...
review.reviewText: For a 3-star hotel it was much nicer than we expected, after staying in a not so great 3-star hotel in Nashville, TN a month ago. Very friendly staff, and they even let us check-in early since there were already clean rooms available when our flight got in. This hotel is a little further from all of the tourist traps(fisherman's wharf), but not to far. Great experience overall!

review.title: Like it
review.reviewText:
good location, price ok, valet parking pricy.
Great breakfast buffet!

review.title: Excellent place to stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: I have stayed at several hotels near Union Square, and this is by far the best. The price was reasonable, the location was with walking distance of Union Square and the Moscone Center, and the hotel was top quality. Also, their are several good restaurants and a Kinko's right next to the hotel, so it is a convenient place to hang your hat while conducting business in the city.

review.title: Would stay here again for sure.
review.reviewText:
Hotel room was clean spacious and everything we needed for a very comfortable stay - Ideally situated for sightseeing and shopping.
Friendly and helpful staff at all times - wouldn't hesitate to stay in this chain again.

review.title: Met our needs perfectly
review.reviewText: This hotel was perfect for what we needed. It was located perfectly for walking down town SF. Lots of super eateries, shopping and people. The draw back was the highway was located very close, but we did not have a room close to it. After checking in all other front desk staff were very helpful and accommodating. Valet parking was very expensive, but the gentlemen were helpful, and seemed to enjoy what they did.

review.title: The hotel on 2nd St. was #1 to me
review.reviewText: I really liked the accomodations at the hotel. They had a Starbucks in the lobby (very convenient) open every time I checked. After 10 p.m. I was able to get something to eat in the market by paying the front desk. The bar was very nice; I had drinks there once and an appetizer another time. I have an iphone but there were 2 computers in the lobby that were very convenient. I only had to wait once to use it and I used it a few times. I never used the gym but its open 24 hours. The concierge/front desk were very helpful when I asked questions.

review.title: San Francisco Marriott Courtyard, financial district
review.reviewText: The hotel room was nice and clean. The bed was not very comfortable but location was great.

review.title: Great value
review.reviewText: We felt like this hotel was very comfortable and close to many of the places we wanted to go, or close to catch public transit. It is a little off the beaten path but we didn't mind the walk. The staff recommended some great restaurants in the area. It is a quiet area on the weekend.

review.title: Great Room Rates but Expensive Parking
review.reviewText: Clean, comfortable rooms. Great room rates, but parking is expensive...$45 overnight!

review.title: 9am is too early?
review.reviewText: room was clean and comfortable. Security came up and told us to be quiet at 9am because we were talking. No music. No TV. Just talking. Jesus people. Get up and get out of bed.

review.title: Near AT&T Park
review.reviewText: This Hotel is right down the street from AT&T Park. The staff was helpful and allowed us to check in early (10am)

review.title: Great Location & Great Value
review.reviewText: The Coutyard Marriott was well located 3 blocks from the museum of modern art.You can't beat the price for that area of San Francisco.Hotel was quiet and clean.Staff was attentive.

review.title: Would recommend
review.reviewText: Great hotel - my expectations were not high - I was booking for location close to a business address where I was having a training. I wouldn't recommend it for a pleasure trip to SF only due to the location. I like the wharf or Union Square areas for that.

review.title: Marriott exceeded my expectations
review.reviewText: My stay at the downtown S.F. Marriott exceeded my high expectations. They granted my request for a room on a higher floor and in the back of the hotel, away from the street. I had a view from my window of the Oakland Bay Bridge. A wonderful view both day or night. My flight got bumped up to a much earlier time, I called the hotel a couple days ahead of time. Of course they would hold onto my luggage. When I got to the hotel, they actually allowed me to check into my room early. I was very surprised and happy about that! I stayed at the hotel for three nights and the room was wonderful, clean, quiet and comfortable. I would be happy to stay there again.

review.title: Great hotel. Only 6 blocks from AT&T park.
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Great room. Close to a lot of restaurants. Would stay here again next time in SF.

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: This is the second time that my wife and I stayed at this hotel and honestly we had a better experience than the first time. The hotel is not far from the main action on Market Street. The hotel is clean, quiet, and has a great staff.

review.title: Served the purpose
review.reviewText: Not anything fancy. It was clean and the staff was helpful.

review.title: Will definitely return.
review.reviewText: Room rate was reasonable. We were able to get the reservation at late notice. Location is great. Very friendly at the main desk.

review.title: Very good stay
review.reviewText: The mattrass was too soft. That was the only compliant I have. Otherwise the hotel was perfect. Good food, service and very clean. I Would recommend this hotel to anyone who stays in San Francisco.

review.title: would definitely stay here again
review.reviewText: The hotel is close to lots of places to eat (fortunately, as the cost of the breakfast in the hotel was a bit steep). We chose to snack at the in hotel Starbucks for breakfast instead, perfectly adequate. Hotel is in good area, close to main shopping street and public transport. Facilities good, had the pool and fitness room to ourselves!

review.title: Great Place to Stay
review.reviewText: This hotel met all our needs. The location was excellent, close to the freeway and any place you wanted to visit. The room was clean and quiet. The staff was so friendly and helpful. I will stay here again on my next trip to SF.

review.title: Great Location, Cute Hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed here on a trip into the city for a concert. The hotel is perfectly located between Fishermans wharf and ATT park. Wonderful service and a great view made this a great pick. I reccomend and we will stay here again.

review.title: Enjoyed My Stay!
review.reviewText: We took an anniversary trip to see an SF Giants Baseball game. Hotel is close to Market Street for shopping and a nice reasonably close walk to the Ball Park (right down the street!). Room was comfortable. Restraunt was a bit pricy but lots of eateries close by. We arrived by Amtrak to the Market Street Bus Stop less than 1/2 mile to hotel. We were able to check in really early, which made our wanderings downtown easier since we didn't have to carry our backpack. Overall great experience and nice place to stay. Staff very helpful and courteous.

review.title: WORST HOTEL SERVICE EVER!
review.reviewText: Worst service ever, Rude , mainly the hotel bar was by far the worst experience i had in SF.

review.title: Just ok
review.reviewText: Front Desk people was not too nice.

review.title: Downtown SF Hotel
review.reviewText: Great location downtown. Can walk everywhere. Great price when using plane/hotel package. Nice hotel. I am staying there again -- and will each time I go to SF

review.title: .Would stay there again...
review.reviewText: The restaurants in the hotel were way overpriced, but the room was nice and the customer service was very good.

review.title: Good location, nice place
review.reviewText: Good value, great location, clean and comfy rooms!

review.title: Really nice....VERY compy beds
review.reviewText: It was a centrally located hotel that was very up scale and reasonably priced for SF. The only really bad part is parking....$50/night is hard to take. Other options are close but still all pricey. Next time I will NOT rent a vehicle until I am ready to go elsewhere. I understand that there is transportation from the airport that can be secured. All in all a nice place to stay :)

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed one night in this hotel for Giant's game. It's a good walking distance to AT&T park. It's close to Yerba Buena Garden. We didn't use our car during our stay in San Francisco. We took bus to Chinatown. My daughter loved playing in the indoor pool which is one of the reason I chose this hotel.

review.title: Would go back again.
review.reviewText: If you prefer a quieter hotel in the middle of San Francisco, then this is it. With a Starbucks in the lobby, and within easy access to downtown SF it couldn't have a better location.

review.title: Great Value
review.reviewText: The hotel was a little further away from union square than I expected, but it had large rooms, great service and we enjoyed our stay.

review.title: Would Stay Here Again
review.reviewText: My wife and I spent 4 nights at the Marriott Courtyard. Our room was spacious and clean. It was only a short walk from the BART station and other means of mass transit was very close by. We will likely stay here again on our next trip.

review.title: SF Coutyard Mariott was a great place to stay
review.reviewText: The hotel was a great place to stay. Clean and neat rooms and other facilities. Courteous staff. Only thing is prices in the restaurant/bar are high so be prepared for the cost. Close to Mosconi Convention Center and several restaurants within walking distance. If you are from the south, you may not realize 3 blocks in San Francisco is more like 5-6 so bring your walking shoes. Overall, well worth it and we plan to return next year and stay at the same hotel again.

review.title: Excelllent view of the city
review.reviewText: I was only there for 1 night on business. The view from my room was excellent. There is a Starbucks on premise which was a great way to start my day.

review.title: Impressed
review.reviewText: Very good position in San fracisco. You guyes don't be disappointed.

review.title: Great hotel!!!
review.reviewText: I spent 3 nights in Marriott Hotel and everything was perfect.

review.title: Solid family choice
review.reviewText: Good choice for families with babies/toddlers. Plenty of room to put up the portable crib. Within walking distance of great shopping and Chinatown. Only negative is there aren't a lot of choices for eating out with kids in the immediate neighborhood.

review.title: Quiet Room
review.reviewText: I liked this hotel because you didn't hear your neighbors or the people outside. Not too many places I can say that about.

review.title: Great Hotel and Location for Convention
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel great staff, rooms where nice size and comforable. Close to so many things. Always bring a jacket.

review.title: The place to stay for a Giants Game
review.reviewText: Our family stayed here for 2 nights over a long weekend to go to the Giants game and play in San Franciso. The hotel is a 10-15 minute walk to AT&T park and even closer to Yerba Buena and the San Franciso Museum of Modern Art. Close, clean and convenient, we'll stay here again.

review.title: Good for family with teens
review.reviewText: The room with 2 comfortable queen beds and a good quality sofa bed was just right for our family (parents, a 15 yr old girl, 12 yr old boy); the pool and free internet access were also great. Only two downsides I can think of--the Courtyard doesn't include any type of free breakfast and the onsite restaurant/room service was too expensive for our family and the location was a bit far from Union Square (15-20 minute walk). However, it would be a great hotel for anyone going to see a Giants game or to events at Moscone Center. The quality of the accomodations, especially for the price paid, more than made up for any drawbacks and we would happily stay at the Courtyard again.

review.title: A luxurious place to stay!
review.reviewText: We walked into an inviting atmosphere, with a comfortable living room area just past the lobby: large armchairs, Oriental carpets, friendly service, and free use of the computers. There is also a bar, which never gets too noisy, a pool, and a workout room. The rooms are large and peaceful, since the hotel has a convenient location but is not right in the hubbub of Union Square. (It's a ten-minute walk.)The hotel staff was friendly and helpful.

review.title: Close to Ball Park
review.reviewText: Great hotel, friendly staff. Have stayed before and both experiences were great. Close safe walk to Giants ball park. Starbucks inside hotel and breakfast at Jasmine's was very good, though rather pricy.

review.title: Loved it
review.reviewText: Cozy, convenient and close enough to public transit, but not smack dab in the middle of the masses.

review.title: Great location to Mascone center
review.reviewText: The bed was one of the best I've ever come to rest in after a long day of education and training. It was like being craddled. I slept great!

review.title: Swayback Beds
review.reviewText: Although the hotel staff was extremely helpful, the concierge left a little to be desired. The room was clean and the hotel cleaning service was impeccable but the bed itself needed replacing. The room was spacious and had a so-so view of the skyline. It's ok if you're on a budget - not really close to anything though (food, nightlife)

review.title: Great hotel & wonderful staff
review.reviewText: I was staying in SF for one night before moving into a new apartment. Vincent, one of the valets, was amazing in helping me to negotiate the parking situation with my moving van! The hotel is nicely located, wonderful environment and the room was HUGE, CLEAN, and WONDERFUL!!

review.title: Not bad
review.reviewText: though not extradordinary either. Good alternative to the many hotels that offers great views of the city. This one, unfortunately, offers little in that category. Comfort, cleanliness, etc. comparable to any other motel in the U.S. I'd recommend the location for those wanting to be off the beaten path.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: This hotel is within walking distance of many sites. It's comfortable and clean. The staff is very friendly.

review.title: clean cheaper place to enjoy SF
review.reviewText: I've stayed at this hotel 3 times, this last time was a little noisy. They are doing some renovations during the day, so if you're hoping for a little extra sleep during the day call and see if renovations are done. This area is a little dead on the weekends, you'll have to walk a bit to find places to eat, one exception is Kate O'Brians around the corner on Howard, its a bar, but its got great food. Check out At&T Park, they have tours daily.

review.title: Good hotel but....
review.reviewText: The fan in the bathroom was not working. They did not offer to change our room. Showers were very humid.

review.title: Breakfast
review.reviewText: Breakfast was good but way overpriced. We paid approx. $35 for two omelettes, juice and coffee.

review.title: Hotel Review
review.reviewText: It was a great hotel and great location. The only thing I was not to happy about was the 45 dollars for parking both most hotels around that area charge that.

review.title: Would recommend
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean, comfortable, and in the perfect location for my business meetings. I will definitely stay there again.

review.title: Best bang for your buck
review.reviewText: Great Hotel. Not too expensive, clean, close to BART.

review.title: Classic Marriot quality
review.reviewText: As always, Marriott came through for us. We especially enjoyed the spacious room, comfortable beds and all-over cleanliness. Fairly quiet area on a weekend, but a decent walk to Union Square.

review.title: Nice hotel!
review.reviewText: Well located, easy access to muni transportation including the BART....just a few blocks away from Market Street and the Ferry Building. It was nice to relax in the whirlpool/pool after sightseeing. Had a good breakfast at Jasmine's, courteous staff, as well as in the bar for my night cap!

review.title: Great downtown bargain
review.reviewText: It was a very affordable hotel, yet very nice hotel, in the downtown area of San Francisco.

review.title: Will stay there again
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean. The service was great and I would definately stay there again.

review.title: I WILL be going back!
review.reviewText: This hotel is located in a superb location - right in the heart of the shopping and financial district. Only 3 blocks from Market St, where you can shop till you drop! The hotel's amenities are great with free internet access, free tea and coffee making facilities, Starbucks in the hotel, sizable gym and swimming pool with whirlpool. And that is just the start of it! The staff are very friendly and always willing to help you. Depending on the room you get, you can see the WHOLE of San Francisco including the Bay Bridge. Top hotel and well worth the stay.

review.title: Nice place
review.reviewText: Overall everything was very nice. The staff was really very friendly. Check in was super quick and the room was big and clean. The only problem was that I received a room service bill for over 100 $ upon check out that I never ordered. The concierge quickly reversed the charges although I wonder how many people check out without really examining their bill.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Stayed at the Marriot Courtyard Downtown Sanfrancisco. Awesome location for shopping! No need for a car as the trolley and taxi's are very excessable. Hotel staff very friendly and helpful. Swimming pool and hot tub comforting. Would go back.

review.title: None
review.reviewText: A very nice hotel. Only thing to complain about was the drinks in the bar and the inefficient staff in the bar/restaurant. A big plus to the staff in the reception/lobby.
review.userLocation: Marina del Rey, Los Angles, CA

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: This hotel is at a convenient location close to restaurants and shopping. It was clean and comfortable.

review.title: In a word: Adequate
review.reviewText: While this hotel is definitely nicer than your average Marriott Courtyard, it offers no more amenities than your typical Courtyard. The staff here rushed me in and rushed me out without many pleasantries. The staff was efficient, but again not overly helpful, when I sought some directions and some local food recommendations. The hotel is in a fairly good location. There's not much on the block; but Market Street, SFMOMA & the Convention Center only about a 10 minute walk away. But for the price, you might as well spend another $25-40 per night and stay at the much nicer hotels in the same neighborhood (and a bit closer to good restaurants, local attractions & the cable cars). In a word and a hyphenate: Adequate and over-priced.

review.title: Great San Francisco Downtown Hotel
review.reviewText: The staff were very friendly and hospitable. Rooms were always well maintained. Convenient location for a downtown hotel and reasonably priced. Only 15 minute walk to Union Square and a 10-15 minute drive to Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: We would go back again
review.reviewText: we found the staff to be very cordial and friendly. Food was a little pricey but delicious.

review.title: Wonderful stay at Courtyard Marriott San Francisco
review.reviewText: We spent three nights at the Courtyard in San Francisco and really enjoyed our stay. The staffs were very nice and accommodating. The hotel room ( we had a standard room with king size bed) was very nice. The room size is large and well designed. I really enjoyed using free high speed internet. The hotel provides Ethernet cable, but they hang it in the closet ( I saw it after i bought the ethernet cable at staple already) The pool was nice and kept clean. The location is in the business district of San Francisco, but we were able to walk to Union Square, Ferry building. Taking cable car to fisherman Wharf is easy and not too far from the hotel. We did not try any restaurants in the hotel because we found a nice Thai restaurant that is really close to the hotel.

review.title: very good hotel near main sites
review.reviewText: very good hotel near main sites. better rate available through expedia. restaurants nearby. SF parking everywhere including here $40/day.

review.title: Fabulous Service
review.reviewText: Everything (room features, hotel amenities, location) was great. However, what will most have me returning to this hotel if I am ever in San Francisco again is the staff. Everyone was friendly, courteous, and knowledgable. By our 2nd visit to breakfast the waiter knew our beverage preference.

review.title: We loved our stay at the Marriott.
review.reviewText: The staff was extremely helpful in explaining how to get around the city in the quick short time we had there and specific to the few items we tried to fit in. The room was in excellent condition, extremely clean, bed very comfortable.

review.title: great place to stay in the city
review.reviewText: great hotel

review.title: Great place to stay for Giants fans
review.reviewText: We were looking for something within walking distance of AT&T park. We have stayed at a Courtyard Marriott in Scottsdale for Giants Spring training so thought we would try the one in San Francisco. We were not disappointed. From easy, fast check-in to imformative staff, it was great. Valet parking is $40 but that's what we expected in the "big city".

review.title: surpsingl really great service
review.reviewText: Really liked the personnel at this hotel. they were very helpful in directing us to various happenings throughout the city. The room was fine but could hae been cleaner.

review.title: In the heart of S.F.
review.reviewText: WE enjoyed our stay at Marriott Courtyard San Francisco Downtown. We were able to walk to the SFMOM and on the way back went through an inside mall close by and to a very nice Tiwanees resturant. The room was resonably priced. The only complant was that we did not have a refrigerator in the room to keep items or a microwave to heat up left overs.

review.title: Many return trips to come
review.reviewText: Location, location, location. We were in walking distance to many attractions. It was our granddaughter's first SF Giants game -- and the Courtyard made it a first class trip. We were able to walk to AT&T Park and enjoy a beautiful day in the city. The staff at the Courtyard made our trip even more special!

review.title: Solid choice in SoMa District
review.reviewText: This is a typical urban Marriott Courtyard. Nice, large, well-maintained lobby (with restaurant/bar) and decent, clean, utilitarian rooms. We were traveling with our two young daughters and liked the fact that we could get a room with two queen beds at a reasonable price--no easy chore in San Francisco! The SoMa District (South of Market Street) has a lot of eclectic eateries and sites, but the unfortunate homeless problem and plethora of panhandlers currently impacting the city are abundantly apparent here. In this regard, the Marriott is somewhat of an insulated oasis, but be prepared to deal with the stark economic realities within a block or two of the building.

review.title: Wonderful Stay
review.reviewText: This Hotel was fantastic. The staff was extremely helpful, our room was clean and nice, and the location was great. The hotel is in a prime location. I was able to to walk everywhere I needed to go. The Bart and Muni systems are right around the block if cheap transportation is needed. The food from room service is the best I have ever eaten at any hotel. I will definitely stay here again.

review.title: cant wait to go back
review.reviewText: everything was great,clean rooms good service on everything we were very happy and will be back.

review.title: Made our first trip to the Bay Area that much better!
review.reviewText: This hotel has everything needed for a great stay in San Francisco; it is impeccably clean, provides great service, and is QUIET. We never heard anyone at all once we closed our door. It is a couple of "big blocks" from public transportation, but we always enjoyed the walk. The front desk was completely accomodating with any request we had. We cannont recommend this hotel enough!

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel for the downtown location. Close to Union Square and transportation

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. Well worth the money. Concierge were extremely helpfull and nice! I do not recommend walking back to the hotal after dark. Homeless and strange people everywhere. In summary nice hotel take taxi back to the door of the hotel after dark.

review.title: Great service!
review.reviewText: The service is outstanding! We were lost and the concierge stayed on the phone with us as we attempted to navigate the city. The only disappointment was the quality of the food (we ordered room service desserts and it was pitiful!) and drinks. Overpriced and poor quality. There are plenty of nearby restaurants, take advantage.

review.title: exell location
review.reviewText: staff was very friendly and helpful, food was very good ,would stay here again

review.title: Will return
review.reviewText: Great hotel in convenient quiet location. Really easy to get everywhere. Super clean, helpful and friendly. Sal,the concierge organised a car to and from airport and no charge for a late check out. Great non tourist eateries in the area.

review.title: Great place for Giants Fans to stay!
review.reviewText: This hotel is the closest to the Giants Stadium. There is a $40/night valet parking fee but is well worth it if you plan to stay for the weekend. Parking can be really expensive in SF!! We were able to leave our car at the lot until 11pm the day we checked out so we again saved on parking. They also held our bags at the desk and we were able to pull them out temporarily to get items during the day before the game. We were able to hit 2 games that weekend!! Buffet breakfast at this hotel was fantastic. Great service from all the staff and the beds were so comfortable!! Lots of pillows. Concierge was very helpful. I will definitely stay here again!!!

review.title: beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: great place to stay, no parking though!!

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Close to AT&T Park and public transit. Very friendly staff and comfortable beds. The only complaint is that it took too long to get my car back from the valet after I checked out.

review.title: Would certainly stay again
review.reviewText: Great service from the guys behind reception, good location and pretty good prices. Didn't get to see much of the hotel to be honest as I was too busy enjoying SF, but what I did see was very satisfactory.

review.title: Great but parking a problem
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was wonderful with clean and comfortable rooms. However, we were staying here as part of a much longer trip to the area and found the $40 (plus tax) fee for valet parking ridiculous. Visitors should understand that the hotel has nothing but valet parking; if you want to park on your own you have to do it at your own risk at some of the nearby lots. The price saved by staying downtown instead of closer to Fisherman's Wharf was negated by the high parking fees.

review.title: Ease of Location
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel was perfect. It is within walking distance to shopping, mass transportation, attractions and my Mom's home. My trip was enjoyable due to the ease of getting where I needed to be at any particular time of the day.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The hotel was centrally located but on a quiet street. The room was large and comfortable. The bus stop is directly across the street. The area around the hotel is clean and inviting.

review.title: Excellent Service
review.reviewText: Service was excellent and the people were friendly and dedicated. When I forgot an item they sent it immediately home by courier. Congatulations!!!!

review.title: Great vacation!
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was friendly and the concierge was very helpful with directions to local attractions and suggestions for eateries. My room was comfortable and clean and the hotel has wonderful amenities. I would definitely stay here again on my next trip into San Francisco.

review.title: Great Deal in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel was only 3 or 4 blocks from the subway. Art gallery and convention center are nearby. Only six blocks to AT&T Park. Hotel staff was super friendly and made several good resturant recommendations.

review.title: Only one problem but the rest was perfect....
review.reviewText: It appears that the $40 a day for valet parking does not include the valets helping with bags, even as my wife had to pack a trunk full of bags with two small kids in tow. No tip for them. The rest of the stay was outstanding and the restaurants had great food.

review.title: Excellent place to stay!
review.reviewText: This was our very first time in SF and we booked the hotel blindly, but based our decision on Expedia's customer reviews, which were right on the money. The hotel is in a central downtown location, with the F line within walking distance and a line of cabs outside if you prefer that instead. It's less than 2 miles to most tourist places in the area (i.e. Fisherman's Warf/ Pier 39, Ghirardelli Sqaure, etc). The Starbucks in the lobby was extremely convenient, and there were plenty of places to eat that you could walk to. The staff was always helpful with giving directions to places and suggesting the best way to get there, as well as restaurant recommendations. Very friendly and courteous. Rooms were clean and spacious and the bed & pillows were SO comfy. The only complaint was the cost for parking, which was equal to another night's stay when all was said and done, but apparently that's to be expected for the area. Overall, we will definitely stay here again if we ever get back to San Francisco!

review.title: Great Location, within walking distance to the public transportation
review.reviewText: Room is very comfortable and clean, we had a king size bed with a sofa bed and free internet access in the room. The hotel is located in the financial district, it's quiet at night, but we did not have problem walking back to the hotel, I think it's safe. From hotel to Union square and cable car stop is about 15 to 20 minutes walk.

review.title: Nice location and features
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed this hotel and it was in a great location. I just wish the Starbucks in this hotel did not close at noon. There were many times we wanted to go to the lobby for coffee or a snack and the Starbucks was always closed.

review.title: Average hotel
review.reviewText: Good location for Embarcadero, Petco Park and South Beach areas. No self-park, Valet only (very expensive) Room warm at night, can't open windows. Restaurant wasn't open Sunday night.

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: Our stay was short, however the staff was very helpful and knew the city well. We would stay here again. Very clean and convinent to everything Thank you

review.title: Would return to this Marriott
review.reviewText: The hotel was located in the financial district of SF and was close to Market St., the Embarcadero and great shopping. The only drawback was that the parking fee was a bit steep.

review.title: Fine Wine Stay at Beer Prices
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel with a very comfortable room. Staff was friendly and helpful. All the ammenities including free internet service. Great for buisness or pleasure. If it had not been for a woman "hogging" the printer (clearly not the fault of the hotel) the stay would have been perfect.

review.title: This is my new favorite place to stay in San Francisco!
review.reviewText: I was in San Francisco to enjoy the Chinese New Year festivities. This was a great place to stay - close enough to shopping and Chinatown. It was very easy to get there too - the directions I got were easy to follow. The room was immaculate and very upscale. It felt very extravagent and have a lovely view of the bridge. I will definately stay here again!

review.title: very impressed
review.reviewText: For the price it was a great room I would expect to pay more for what I got. The service was great, I lost my cell phone, key and eyeglasses in the pool area within 30 min I had them back. Close to Market st. where all the good shopping is and not too far from Fishermans Wharf. Take advantage of their breakfast Buffet at the Jade located in the hotel, Verry Good.

review.title: Nice hotel-not a great location
review.reviewText: Hotel was under going a remodel and had limited on site food services. Staff was very nice. Had a lot of rain when we were in town but Frisco is easy to from place to place. Parking fees were too high (appx 40.00 per night) On site Starbucks needs to be open longer.

review.title: good price for a very good position
review.reviewText: the only problem was in the night...the hotel is not directly on a bus line, so you need to walk a little bit...

review.title: Excellent Service, Very Comfortable
review.reviewText: Service was excellent, the room was nice size with desk, table, sofa and a very comfortable king bed and from the 11th floor it had a nice view of the city. The shower provided instant-on hot water and a variable pulse shower head that felt wonderful. Although we couldn't use Wi-Fi, there were a set of computer cables in a bag in the closet. Downsides: The restaurant was good but a little pricy, and the towels could have been a better quality to match the bedding.

review.title: Very nice!
review.reviewText: Everything was very nice. Close to downtown. Room service was very good.

review.title: splendid.
review.reviewText: Although our stay was short, it was extremely sweet. Beautiful hotel, kind and helpful staff, extremely comfortable room with a stunning view.

review.title: great baseball trip hotel
review.reviewText: excellent accomadations close to AT&T Park, great for game trips. Poolis very small, and only 3.5 feet deep, but younger kids will still enjoy it.

review.title: Nice.
review.reviewText: The only part that was disappointing was the price of the valet parking ($38/night), but it's expensive to park almost anywhere in San Fran.

review.title: Great value in a great location
review.reviewText: This was a very good value for the price, I stayed with our teenage son and we had ample room to spread out and the room was clean and comfortable. Although a small detail, there was never a long wait for elevators. We could walk to most major destinations or take nearby convenient transportation. The location was so good that we could return to the hotel to drop things off or rest between outings. We had limited interaction with the staff and when we did they were polite and helpful. Our room did not have much of a view but rooms on upper floors on the North and East would definately have great views towards the downtown financial district and the SF/Oakland Bay Bridge. I saw the review by a previous guest mentioning that they had a Starbucks in the lobby which is was a welcome extra.

review.title: Great location; great hotel
review.reviewText: We were worried about our hotel choice because we had never been to SF. However, the hotel was a great location on 2nd and Folsom in the Soma district. We walked everywhere. Some walks were long, but with all the sites to see, you are occupied on the walk. The cross street (Folsom) ends right in front of the Giants Stadium. It was an easy walk to the stadium. The hotel was great and so was the staff. I would highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Great stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: My 2 teenager sons and I went to San Francisco for a "boys weekend" and we had a great time. The hotel was extremely clean, the staff was great and the location was good. We will definately be back

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: I found the hotel staff to be very helpful and courteous. The hotel is located within walking distance of many attractions and within easy access to public transportation. If I find myself going to San Francisco in the future I would stay at the Courtyard Marriott again.

review.title: Everything I needed
review.reviewText: I took my 10 year old daughter to SF for a 3 day vacation - and this hotel worked really well. We checked in without any problems, had a very BIG and clean room (note: some hotels in SF have smaller-than-average rooms), and my daughter loved the indoor pool and jacuzzi. It's about 5 blocks from Market street, so use caution when walking back to the hotel at night. It's close to the MOMA and other convention area attractions. It's also very close to ballpark - so it might be a great place to stay for a game. The breakfast is free for kids - and the staff was extremely friendly.

review.title: Very nice!
review.reviewText: I will definitely stay at this hotel again. Very nice, clean, wonderful bed. Nice a roomy. Quiet. Nice location.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Very comfortable Hotel in DT San Francisco. Very close the Ball Park and having a Starbucks in the Lobby is a plus!

review.title: Great hotel for SF MOMA or Giants Game
review.reviewText: We found this to be just the right hotel to stay in when visiting the Museum of Modern Art and / or attending a Giants game. We were able to walk to either venue. The hotel also offers great views, the staff is friendly and capable, and the room service is good. The only downside was the cost of valet parking. Again the service was good, but we thought the cost should have been included as part of the stay. Over all, a very good place to stay. It was Comfortable, without being too fancy or costing too much.

review.title: Great hotel in beautiful city
review.reviewText: We were very happy with our experience at this hotel. It's close enough to some of the main attractions of San Francisco, but yet, it felt peaceful and secluded. Would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Spacious, Great Location
review.reviewText: The best thing about this hotel was the location -- close to Market Street and just about every bus line. We even walked from the Ferry Building one night and it only took about 15 minutes, even with two children in tow. We also enjoyed being so close to Yerba Buena Gardens, which has a carousel, a kids' museum and a great playground, and the California Academy of Science on Howard Street. The hotel's pool was a hit with my girls, ages 7 and 5, particularly because it was only 3 feet deep. The hotel room itself had 2 queen beds, which are tough to find in San Fran. Most hotels only offer doubles for the same price. The sitting area was spacious enough to have our Starbucks breakfast (located downstairs) and serve as a play area for the girls. I'd recommend the hotel to other families.

review.title: highly recomended !!!!
review.reviewText: Really clean and good located hotel. The Bart station is just two block from this hotel, so you do not need to pay taxi from/to airport. The F bus line and the cable cars are also really close, these two are the starting point to go around the Bay. Finally you have subway, quisno and others bakery in the area. I will just not returt to this hotel If I want to stay in the middle of Fishersman Wharf. Combine the hotel + flight tickets to find a amazing deal !!!

review.title: SFO Marriott Courtyard
review.reviewText: The hotel is very nice. Although it doesn't have the old feel of SFO, it is spacious (we don't like the tiny rooms of the old hotels), very clean, quiet, and comfy.

review.title: Worth the money
review.reviewText: Very clean rooms with pool, exercise room. Downtown and ballpark within walking distance.

review.title: Added expense
review.reviewText: Great hotel but very expensive breakfast...about 15 dollars a meal, and parking overnight here is 42.50 with tax.

review.title: Comfort and Convenience
review.reviewText: The hotel is conveniently located within walking distance of many of the sites and attractions of San Francisco. The "Bay to Breakers Race" began just down the street, and it was like Mardi Gras without the floats...great fun to watch. The baseball stadium is only a few blocks away and several wonderful restaurants also in close proximity. The room was comfortable and quiet with a nice restaurant for breakfast. The hotel and restaurant staff were attentive without being obtrusive. We would definitely stay at the Courtyard Merriott again.

review.title: Lovely hotel
review.reviewText: Service was great, room was comfortable and clean, everything you're looking for in a few days' stay.

review.title: Excellent location for Kaboom and SF Giants
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel made it perfect for our needs - Kaboom concert/fireworks and sightseeing. Only drawback was that the Starbucks closed at 3pm - so did the Quiznos across the street. So our plan to buy food to take in to the concert failed.....

review.title: location is excellent to downtown and to the ballpark
review.reviewText: modern, clean with good staffing

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Hotel was in a great location. Market Street close by, so was the Embarcadero, AT&T Ball Park and many restaurants!

review.title: Great Hotel for the Price
review.reviewText: Stayed at this hotel on a 3 day weekend. It is in a great area. Close to the F line that travel to the Wharf and Casto. Cleanroom and accomadations. Would totally stay here again.

review.title: Smoking Room for a Non Smoker
review.reviewText: I had reserved a non-smoking room, but they were all full, so they gave me a smoking room. Wasn't that bad, nice room.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Walking distance to SFMOMA, Market Street and the Ferry Terminal Building. My room had a great view of the Bay Bridge.

review.title: Nice hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: This hotel is located in downtown area of San Francisco and is walkable distance to many shopping centers and restaurants.

review.title: A great location and terrific room
review.reviewText: This hotel was in a great location for us. We were able to walk to the modern art museum, the Metreon, and Union Square. The room was large and very comfortable. The only complaint I had was that there were room service trays left out in the hallway for the entire weekend. (None of these trays were from our room, so it was kind of annoying). I would recommed this as a great place to stay.

review.title: Extremely comfortable
review.reviewText: Not extremely luxurious, but nice, clean, and comfortable.

review.title: Week end in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Clean, nicely priced and all the amenities. Has an adjacent Starbucks for those coffee lovers. Has a nice bar with quiet areas by the fireplace and a breakfast restaurant. Everything you need in one place.

review.title: Can't Wait to Go Back
review.reviewText: Great Hotel in Great Location. I would recommend the hotel and will definitely stay there again.

review.title: Good choice in SOMA district
review.reviewText: I've stayed at this Courtyard several times and have had consistently good experiences. Nice clean rooms, relatively quiet, decent workout facility and indoor pool, and cozy lobby bar with friendly staff. Even has a Starbuck's off the lobby.

review.title: Noise Noise Noise!
review.reviewText: stayed on the 8th floor and noise kept entering our room all night long. hard to believe this is a new hotel. noise from above, below, next to us, in the hallway, etc. the sound insulation was terrible!

review.title: Good hotel.
review.reviewText: Very comfortable, professional staff, great location for business travel and vacation.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The hotel is in walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf, Union Station and Chinatown. The rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable. Jasmine's Restaurant provides a nice buffet breakfast. The rooms are reasonably priced. Looking forward to a return engagement.

review.title: Very comfortable and clean. Will come back/
review.reviewText: Our visit to San Francisco was delightful in part because of our at the hotel. The staff were polite and helpful. The condition of the hotel was clean. Was especially satisfied with the location. We were centrally located to all the major attractions. Will come back to SF and this hotel again.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was very nice. The rooms were very clean and the staff was very friendly. The location was great. Lots of shopping near by and the bus stop is accross the street.

review.title: Close to the Giants Baseball Stadium.
review.reviewText: Decent hotel. within walking distance of the SF Giants Stadium. Within walking distance to the train station. Restaurants close by. Located in the financial district. An easy, affordable cab ride or train or bus ride to the tourist sites. Also has an excellent fitness center onsite with a pool . One disappointment was the hot tub was out of order the entire length of our visit, (5days).

review.title: Some rough edges but overall a great hotel for out of the main area
review.reviewText: My wife and I stayed here during Memorial Day weekend 2005. The hotel is not close to the popular Fisherman's Wharf tourist area, but I'd say it's a step above the hotels there. If you don't mind a 3 block walk to Market Street to catch a $1.25 per person trolley ticket to Fisherman's Wharf, you can make the trip with no problem. The Courtyard "Dowtown" sports a decent bar and restaurant area with an internal Starbucks soon to open. The lobby is set off with an atractive lounge equipped with fireplace that was used to host a high school reunion on the Friday we stayed at the hotel. The reunion proved to highlight the only drawback of the hotel. If somebody's partying in the middle of the night, you will hear each and every hallway conversation through your room door. If you notice a large gathering planned at the hotel, ask for a remote room as soon as possible or you will probably not be accomodated.

review.title: Very satisfied
review.reviewText: I was impressed with this hotel. Not only is it located in a prime spot but its really nice and comfortable. My favorite part was the outside patio. I recommend a stay and will return.

review.title: Nice hotel, good location
review.reviewText: The staff is friendly, rooms are clean, location is great for business in the South or Market area

review.title: My best experience is a large city as far as hotels are concerned
review.reviewText: Everyone was very friendly and helpful. We never ate in the hotel restaurant, but did have room service deliver one time. The food was pretty good for a hotel. What impressed my wife and I the most was the knowledge by the entire staff of all local happenings, restaurants, bars, and even bus stops and schedules. They even set up our 1 day car rental for us.

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: The service and quality was great.

review.title: Not totaly impressed,
review.reviewText: Very little in the way of food or beverage between breakfast and 6.00pm. No gift shop for supplies. Clean and centrally placed but not my choice next time.

review.title: Good downtown location
review.reviewText: Conscierge was most helpful.

review.title: Nice Surprise
review.reviewText: This hotel was much better than I expected. It was in a great location in the SOMA area. The hotel itself was very cute with a four sided fireplace in the lobby/lounge area, and whimsical sculpture and artwork. The rooms, while nothing special, were roomy and clean. When I didn't like the noise and view over a highway in one room, they moved me to a room with a great view including a glimpse of the bay.

review.title: Four Minus One Star Hotel
review.reviewText: Clean, but not luxurious hotel.

review.title: Great location for Conference, staff excellent
review.reviewText: The hotel is maintned well and the staff were friendly and helpful.  Had a great trip and would stay there again for any business trip in downtown San Francisco.

review.title: Comfortable, good location, good price
review.reviewText: Downtown San Francisco, comfortable accommodations, friendly service -- all at a price we could afford.

review.title: Clean, very comfortable place to stay.
review.reviewText:
ALthough parking is expensive, valet service was very efficient. Very good hotel with fairly reasonable price.
Hotel maintenance and front desk service were very good & prompt.
